lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The three of us who were gone are happy to be back. We missed you guys terribly. Back from the dust and chaos. Anyway! As we adjust, let's get through our announcements real fast. First and foremost, we have two wonderful sponsors tonight, beginning first with our friends at D&D Beyond!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond! Is this me? Okay. Guys-- I'm actually nervous. Guys, the number nine has been very important to us, and tonight, it's important for another reason. D&D Beyond wants you to know that at 9pm tonight, the Waterdeep Dragon Heist adventure releases on D&D Beyond. That's 9:00pm Pacific. That's in two hours, so it'll officially be available for purchase through D&D Beyond Marketplace. Don't forget to pick it up in a couple of hours, set your alarms. We'll probably remind you when 9:00 comes around. But that's not all. The number nine is special for other weird reasons. This Sunday, September 9th, or 9/9, is the first game of the regular season for Travis' favorite team, the Dallas Cowboys. They're already ranked top of their conference, as much as it pains me to say. Travis, two years ago, they won nine straight games. Last year, they won how many regular season games?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (mumbling) Nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine, yes! And this year, in training camp, the standout defensive player was none other than Antwaun Woods, number 99. To honor this amazing concurrence of the number nine, I have done the unthinkable. I am wearing a Dallas Cowboys t-shirt. And guys, I have to say, it feels pretty good. It feels pretty outstanding. Actually, it feels a little odd.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, what's happening?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, it feels really weird!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, guys! I think my heart exploded! Oh god, guys, I think I-- (gasping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. He died because of the shirt! We have to get the shirt off of him! We have to get the shirt off!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Were you an accomplice in this fucking thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to take it off of him, quick!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (gasping) Oh, guys! Guys, it was the shirt! And now I feel better!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you get blood on my fucking clothes--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have to play like that all night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And definitely blood on the Wyrmwood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh wow that's everywhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing hard)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: New level. Hope it was worth it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm covered in blood!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It went down instead of up, didn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's everywhere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a change of pants?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT, TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what you get! You call down the thunder and you pay for it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look, guys, the point is, he's alive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Blood. I love you, Travis. Go Dallas.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's why you wouldn't hug me before the show. No hugs before the show when you're up to shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I saw Max holding that tubing. Should have asked. Should have known.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're going to be so sticky. What's it taste like? Peppermint?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mmm! That's not good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't think that's mouth blood. There's different types for on-camera stuff. Well, Sam, I'm happy you're healthy and that you survived this terrible assault.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Special effects, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Laura, were you recruited to help with that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She texted me saying, "Is Travis going to be upset with me?" and I was like, "No, he's just "going to be upset with me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm. I'm actually very proud of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I guess the rest of us can't understand the pressure of coming up with a D&D Beyond bit every week.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He finally snapped! He covered himself in fake blood!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, jumped the shark on that one, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry. More announcements, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, thank you, Sam, and thank you, D&D Beyond.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to go take a flash shower?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Following up on that, we have another announcement that went up. We're excited that we're now doing a live show for our appearance at New York Comic Con.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's our first time on the east coast; take a train, take a plane, take an automobile! Whatever it takes, come and see us. I do believe that the VIP tickets are sold out, but there are plenty General Admission seats still available. It is a gorgeous theater. Liam, back me up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's actually a few little orchestra seats that are still available.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's covered in gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We would love to see you there. It's going to be raucous and amazing. If you haven't made it to our GenCon liveshow or one of the ones we did in LA back in the day, don't miss it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one we did in LA.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, the one we did in LA. It's frenetic and crazy, so please, please come and join us. It'll be amazing and I'm sure Sam will dress entirely normally.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm sure. And we'll actually have Laura and Travis for this one, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No one's going to retain any of the things you just said in the wake of that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But there will be links to buy tickets somewhere. You can get them on Ticketmaster. Just go to Ticketmaster, look up Critical Role.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: critrole.com has all the information as well. Marisha, I believe you had the latest episode of Handbooker Helper.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, super quick, to address all the people who are a little confused why we went from dice basics to character sheets: we're wanting to show that we're going to be doing a little bit of everything. We're going to be rolling out tips while we also build out character stuff. That way we can get newbies playing as quickly as possible, because in our experience, the first thing you do is push over a character sheet to somebody.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jump right in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We jump right in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Best way to learn to swim.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're also two weeks in, and in a year, there will be a library of content that will last forever, or until civilization falls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So be patient! Rules are coming. It is coming.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll them if you got them!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can only produce as fast as Max's little hands can manage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (deep voice) Go faster!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough. Thank you, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a really good Doctor Claw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's such a classic voice. Ah, I love it. Sam, you have something you want to talk about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a quick update to the Pablove Foundation charity push.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you have squibs of fake shit ready for this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We hit our first two goals. We hit $20,000, which means I'll be running a one-shot of Crash Pandas. We hit $50,000, which means that the Critters have contributed enough money to finance an actual research grant that will go towards curing childhood cancer, and so we've added a new goal. We're going to try and raise $100,000 for the Pablove Foundation, and if we hit that goal, Sam-- that's me-- will do a special Fireside Chat, complete with robe and fancy wine.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That $100,000 will be able to fully fund the Shutterbugs Summer Photography Camp, which is a week-long summer camp for children suffering from cancer, and they can all get to go to this photography camp and they learn how to do art and it's incredible. More details are at critrole.com and donate now at give.classy.org/teamherter. All the links will be before you. More announcements!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was that word in there? Classy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Classy, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was so hard watching you deliver that while looking like you just murdered someone in cold blood. You were talking about wonderful things while looking so incriminating.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This comes out. This washes out, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, definitely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. Thank you, Critters, for your fantastic support of this awesome charitable cause. Also wanted to give a quick congratulations to all of our Indian Critters of the LGBT community for a fantastic win today. Love you very much, and a step in the right direction. Now, let me see. Do we have any merch announcements, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got pins and we've got t-shirts and we've got bumper stickers that are praising the Traveler's name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing southward, past the Wuyun Gate, had a brief encounter with two ettins, you managed to make your way to the Menagerie Coast itself, seeing the gorgeous shores, the eastern jungles, the waves in the distance, and on the way, actually purchased some pets as well, from a traveling merchant caravan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a totally smart idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What have we done?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ridiculous. They're going to be dead in a day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Best idea ever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Best.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, jesus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did he write?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why would you do this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) And you did that with blood on your hands! Terrible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This will work out way better than that Tamagotchi you owned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mighty Nein, as you close the final miles to the outskirts of the northern side of Nicodranas, the first and one of the major port towns in the Menagerie Coast, what would you like to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you guys want to see? What do you want to do when we're here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're here. What is there to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, what is there to see?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the main points of historical interest?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know a lot, but there's the Lavish Chateau.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Lavish Chateau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that where your mom works?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I want to see that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a tourist spot?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it's a really nice-- it's an inn, you know? And my mom performs there. It's really nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that sounds nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, everybody's seen the ocean before, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I have never seen the ocean.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, one, two, three? Never seen the water?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not interested really, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You should, it's amazing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to see that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you not, either? Four?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I've been landlocked my whole life, man. You guys are the only two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. I feel like we're about to improve all of your general experiences of the world.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really-- it's the opposite of fire, Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you-- what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we drive towards the coast and then, you know, take the PCH down to Nicodranas? What do you think?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Big Sur is nice this time of year.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Carmel-by-the-Sea's a peach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I should probably keep myself disguised while we're here, though, just in case.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, why exactly aren't you allowed back home?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's told us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I pissed off that guy and he said he would kill me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, to kill you. That's right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does that mean that he would hire people to kill you, or he would personally kill you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he didn't seem like the type that would really do a lot of killing himself, you know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But is wealthy and connected?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, and there's a lot of people you can talk to here. If you want to get somebody killed, here's the town to do it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe you could fill him in again about why your--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, you don't remember, do you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I do. I'm looking out for our tall cow friend.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I heard the whole story between games, I don't really-- you should just know--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I know what's happening. I'm just trying to, you know, schedule a tea break.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no. I pissed off this guy. He was there to see my mom. The Traveler was teaching me different spells at the time, you know? I had just started learning about them. So I sort of made myself look like my mother.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And he tried to get with you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I sort of lured him out onto the balcony.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's right, and embarrassed him. In the nude.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he was just stuck out there. That's all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You locked him out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, without pants, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's really funny. Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you remember his name?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lord Sharpe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lord Sharpe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow. Is that a chosen name? Is he an edgelord Sharpe?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. He was super not sharp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, he's a dumb dumb?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you were talking about the mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did he just visit all the time, or is he well known in Nicodranas for business, or shady dealings?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. I didn't even know he was a lord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, you just found out afterwards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So this was a random hit. He was a random hit job for your Traveler shenanigans.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nobody made it out clean from that place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about besides your mother's place of employment? Do you know, are there other things to see?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, all over the Opal Archways is this really pretty-- it's a great marketplace and stuff. Lots of shops. I didn't see too much, from my window you could see all the houses. It looked like a quilt. It was beautiful with the roofs. And you could see the ocean, so I know the wharfs are around there, you know?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep, indeed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, should we go to some of your favorite places first?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we see the ocean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to see my room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to go straight there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we can go to the ocean first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The road down is treacherous. The benefit of being on the coast is that you limit your field of danger, right, it's only going to come from one direction. That's just something to keep in mind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a very fair point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, but what about all the sea monsters?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you definitely have sea creatures that haunt your dreams.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no. Not true, actually. I have never seen--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Giant sea monsters.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You coughed up salt water, and you weren't even near the ocean. That feels like the ocean's real dangerous to me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That could be a pituitary thing. I have never seen a sea creature in my life.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's so many. I saw a giant tentacle come out of the water one time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right on the coast, you saw that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A tentacle came out of the water?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw it from my window. It was a really, really, really big tentacle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course I did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I believe her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, that's not terrible. Oh, it is terrible. 14.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really, really, really saw a tentacle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A really big one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How close do we have to be to the ocean while we walk alongside it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I mean, as close as you want to be. If you want to put your feet in, it's an amazing experience.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I definitely want to do that. That sounds great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's colder than you might think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't have any expectations, so, I'm not sure if that's true or not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: From where we are now, would I have any idea how far from the gates that we just-- have we passed through the gates?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't made it to the gates of the city yet. You're probably about 20 or so minutes from reaching the exterior of Nicodranas. If you were to head straight south, as opposed to continuing on the somewhat southwestern path towards the city, you would eventually hit the shoreline on the eastern side of the city for about 40, 45 minutes or so to get there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well we're so close, we might as well stop in--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stop by the ocean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Well, or your mom's place. Whatever you want to do first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So is there a location to go to the ocean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I forget you haven't seen it. So if you look in one direction, and you look immediately to your left and then immediately to your right, all that shit is ocean.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All of it. And as far as-- you see that line?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The horizon? That's all ocean, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's crazy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really big. It's like a lake, only a lot bigger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've seen big lakes, but you can always see the other side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, imagine not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, sometimes-- okay. Point stands.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the water is not that greenish dark color. It's really beautiful and light blue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I've only read flowery poetry that makes it talk about--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Once we get up over this next hill, you'll see the ocean.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So heading southward, deviating from the path that leads directly into Nicodranas, The Mighty Nein makes their way southward towards the shoreline. The better part of an hour passes. You can see to the right, the exterior walls of the city and beyond the somewhat light gray to white patterned walls. They may have been gray at one point, but the white pattern you can see across them seems to be layers and layers and years and years of seagull excrement having gathered, stronger towards the southern side of the wall as you pass near that section of the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Disguise Self.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What do you look like?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Basically me, only human.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Human Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All the same, only yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Blue skin gone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Blue skin's gone, horns are gone, no tail.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That cute little bob.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cute little bob, but it's black hair instead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So cute. You look like Catherine Zeta-Jones in Chicago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Super tan skin?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, great. Continuing on this way, you begin to see the seagulls now, new birds for a lot of you here. You can see these white (cawing) going overhead as they begin to cluster and hit the shoreline. You see a few of them diving towards the water as you begin to look past the edge of the rock into the sand bank. You can see eventually as your cart begins to make its way towards the rougher bit of terrain before it breaks at the ocean, the actual waves now crashing up against the shore and now pulling away. Pushing again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's horrifying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's everywhere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is everywhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's coming to get us. It's literally coming to get us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it stays right there. It goes in and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It comes towards us every 15 seconds or so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so blue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those are seagulls. They are some dickheads. If you leave food out, they'll snake that shit in a second.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They make horrible noises.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will they?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah. And they drop shit on you from above, so keep your eye out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Most birds do that, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: These ones in particular are pricks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I join Caduceus in the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, looking past the afternoon sun at this vantage point especially, you can see it dancing across the distant horizon shore like hundreds of little glistening flecks of glass. The shore's sound itself is very soothing as you approach and pull up your pants and take off your boots to begin to step into the soft sand. You can see large rocks that occasionally break up the beach itself that jut outward, and on these you can see small carvings. You can see things that have been drawn on them with chalk, it looks like, that have been mostly washed away or eroded with time. As close as maybe 150 feet out, you see a small fishing ship that is on the outskirts of the southern portion of the city. Glancing off to the right to where the city docks begin, you can see dozens of ships that are in the middle of the harbor, that are coming into the harbor, many that are in the process of being anchored and then set up within the docks themselves. This eastern side you recognize as the Restless Wharf of the city and you know the harbor is broken into two different sides.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a moment to look through the sand and rocks and see if there's anything interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Investigation. Never mind, that's a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find a lot of really soft sand. You start putting it into piles, and then you start building a cool little mound and a wave comes and destroys it and you're a little sad. But that's how life works.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, the lessons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Makes sense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I go out to the rocks and see how far I can hop along the rocks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah. There's the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know how to swim, Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rocks are pretty disparate amongst the shore here. There is one section where you can see a string of four rocks at different heights that eventually get to about 30 or so feet out into the shore before they disappear beneath the ocean surface. So before you even touch the water you dive on up to one of the rocks, and as you get to the top your hands hit there and you can already see the top of the rock is bleached white with seagull shit. But it's dry. Glancing over the side, you make a leap to the next one. Make an athletics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there easy access to the water here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You can just walk right into it. It's an open beach right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Caduceus, as you put your feet into the water it is quite cool. It isn't freezing, it's a comfortable temperate temperature. You feel the sand grip and slowly dissipate between your toes as you pull it in. It's a really unique sensation and you can't help but be excited by it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're right, this is spectacular.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right? Pretty nice. Soak it up, man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau is going to perch on the rock, and for the first time ever, willingly meditate, while just focusing on the blue that she is now surrounded by.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb has just been staring for a while, and is standing next to Nott. He takes off every stitch of clothing and everything except for one thing, and hands it to Nott and walks in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as Caleb--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb's naked!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb slowly submerges entirely into the ocean.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just going to walk out into it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Up to the neck, or fully submerged?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He would keep going and eventually start floating on my back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually you see Caleb vanish beneath the ocean. There's a brief moment of worry as a few seconds pass with no sight before you see (bloop), buoyantly finding his way to the surface.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: See, Nott? Easy as pie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can still see your weenie! I can see it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think his ears are underwater.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to nicely fold his clothes and put it on a nearby log or something. Then I'll pull up my Cloak of Elvenkind and put out a couple of pieces of meat, because Fjord told me that seagulls come for food. I'll hide and have my crossbow loaded and ready to go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not stopping her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you crouch down, you notice the clothing you place as Caleb begins to shift. Moving slowly to one side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you trying to prank, Caleb? I will not stand for that. Well, I'll go fetch it. Pick it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull it up, and you see beneath it a large sand crab that emerges from underneath it, looks up at you with two small black beads for eyes, and the claws (snapping).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to try to grab it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a dexterity check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, not good. Dexterity check? 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. It rolled exactly an 11 on its dexterity, so you manage to just capture it. It's going to attempt to snipe at you. That's a 17 to hit with the armor class.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It hits!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your thumb clamps down and there's an immediate flash of pain through your body.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's bleeding so much! There's so much blood!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're trying to shake it off, it's still whipping back and forth, holding on tightly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go down on it with my knee. Jump up and knee down on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, not good! Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a little bit of effort. It takes you two or three leaps, because it keeps skittering out of the way, and you're not about to be bested by a small crustacean. For the third try, you manage to get just enough leverage as you push into the air, and with one resounding crack down through its external shell, it releases its grip somewhat on your thumb. You have to actually pry it off. It seems to be locked into its death grip.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You fought bravely. Hmm, more bait! I'll break a bunch of the crab and put it out. And go back to my perch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and over the next ten minutes or so, you watch as one seagull comes down, eats and grabs it, (whooshing) about 25 of them suddenly descend as word gets out and you're surrounded by white birds. We'll say, for the sake of narrative, you manage to pick off about eight of them before they end up scattering away from it. You have this beach riddled with dead seagulls, with crossbow bolts out of their bodies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll retrieve the crossbow bolts and that's it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You just leave them dead?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm going to take the bodies, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a question. Right now, where is the Lavorregard menagerie?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where is the owl, the weasel--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the cart, I believe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no, I have Nugget with me, weasel's little Sprinkle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Owl, too? Owl's with you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, owl's by the cart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I need constant updates to where these animals are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sprinkle is here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the weasel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Like on a doughnut.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We did some training on the road.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I want to play fetch with Nugget, here at the beach.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: if you guys are doing some training, what are you training him in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to train Nugget to blink back to us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On a command?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to take you a couple hours of working with him here on the beach, but you can do that. Make an animal handling check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god. I'm so scared.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Say goodbye to that King Charles spaniel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, utilizing bits of the feed and the snacks that you had purchased off of the original vendor, with Sprinkle tucked up in your neck, and they're focused on their various endeavors, Jester's tunnel vision focused on this adorable little blink dog. The fur is a light tan color with bits of faintly darker brown stripes and a hint of calico elements to its coat, but very faint along the back. Oversized puppy paws that look soft and goofy, but the limbs themselves are a little unnaturally angular for a natural dog. You can see some of its fey nature peeking through in its features. Its ears are very tall and pointed, though wide at the base. As you start teaching it to blink, you watch as it prepares each time, and as it begins to figure out the commands and what you're trying to guide, the eyes begin to go from a dark black to a bright blue right before it blinks over here and the eyes fade from blue to black as soon as it manages to find its next location. Over the next two hours or so of you working with this, you begin to eventually develop the early stages of finding ways to command it to teleport when you want it to, although you can't really guide where it's going to teleport yet. But you've learned a command or a whistle of your choice that will tell it to blink.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So happy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, this is so wonderful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't wait for this to go wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you get to decide on that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If she has ten gold pieces worth of incense she can bring it back to-- nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you name your owl?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you name your owl?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is Professor Thaddeus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well yeah, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He looks like a professor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He looks like a Thaddeus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I couldn't decide if he looked more like a professor or more like a Thaddeus and then I realized--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why not a both?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you meditate for the full two hours that she's training the blink dog, or do you return to Professor Thaddeus in the cart?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, Beau could not meditate for two hours. No. I meditate for ten minutes, tops. Then I go back and-- I want to train Professor Thaddeus to come when I look regal and hold out my arm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you stand about 50 yards from the cart and hold aloft your forearm, and attempt to find a way to coax Professor Thaddeus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Professor!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an animal handling check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Professor, come!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Offer it tenure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exactly. Oh, that's pretty good! 21? I rolled a natural 18, 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to find coaxing it with pieces of meat that you scavenge from the remnants of the meal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I have a gull?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have a whole seagull!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're waving the seagull, it seems a bit large, but eventually, in smaller pieces, you begin to realize you can coax it and you can get it to come to you when you have a piece of food in your grasp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's so moody.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mr. Owl, how many handling checks does it take--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: A one, a two, a three.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Owls are dicks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You've begun the process of forming a bond with your animal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a minute to try and explain to the Professor what a doctorate is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If he's confused.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I just nod and hope that Thaddeus is listening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thaddeus seems to already have a stronger bond with Caduceus than you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stop talking to my owl.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While this chaos is happening with Caduceus slowly wading through the shoreline, Caleb floating in the distance, practically nude, Nott diminishing the population of the various waterfowl, and those two training their pets, what are you doing, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, are you sure you don't want to come in? I'm sure Jester would hold your hand or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds lovely, but I think I'll just watch from the shore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I'll walk up to the shore and put my boots in, ankles deep, in the water and stand there. Then I'll summon the falchion next to my side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the falchion emerges from whatever pocket space it resides when not in use, there's a splash of ocean water across the ground, flung from the very faint bit of force that is released upon its summoning. As you hold it in your grasp and hold it before you, looking at it for a moment, the sunlight gleaming off the blade showing the intricacies of its curvature, of the falchion Summer's Dance mutation that has come from the consuming of the blade not long ago. It feels cold, same temperature of the ocean that you're currently sitting in, and as the temperature of the ocean warms to your touch so does the temperature of the blade you're holding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hmm. How far out is Caleb in the water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say he's about 15 feet out. Not too far.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use Misty Step to appear right next to him in the water and scare the shit out of him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may. Caleb, as you've been lying there, looking up into the beautiful blue sky with faint tufts of white drifting by, but mostly this unending sphere of blue color before you, Fjord just appears, a shadow above you, looming in the water.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scheisse! (coughing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa, hey! All right there, chief. Okay, all right, you're good. Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can't just sneak up on a person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, I just figured you want some company. It's really tranquil, isn't it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (groaning) Oh, it's very quite nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. You seem very at home in the water, I'm surprised.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I tuck down four feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, no, I am just submerging my bits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I must commend you. A lot of people are very trepidatious in the face of a force of nature like this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's expansive, it just keeps going forever.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It suits you very well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why did you leave it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I've always loved the water, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it feels good to be back, ja?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It does, yeah. I would live right on the water if I could. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So maybe you stay this time?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I take care of what I need to take care of, I think a calm life on the water would suit me just fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a unique visual perspective here, too, as Caleb is no longer just floating buoyant, but who has probably not had too much experience swimming in the past, is having to haphazardly thrash--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 15 feet out?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They drop right the fuck off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 15 feet out is far.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's closer to 20, we'll say. Enough to the point where you can submerge and touch your feet underneath, but to stay above the water you're talking as you thrash. Fjord is gently buoyant, occasionally putting the hands in the water, the armor itself keeping you mostly aloft by its enchantment, and just being comfortable in the water it's Fjord looming over as you're keeping up with him best you can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like us when we went scuba diving.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take a moment and scan the beach and call out: Nott the Brave, live up to your name and jump in the ocean!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There is no comma, there is no comma!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that-- it-- yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's so big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There is a comma. There is a comma! I know what I'm talking about, get in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who cares? Go swimming!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give me a minute. I just ate some seagull I need to wait a half hour.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's an old wives' tale, it's not true!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think it's true, I'm cramping. I'm cramping already. It could be the crab that bit me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is it with Nott and the water, do you have any idea?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. She doesn't like to swim, I don't think. But you'd imagine seeing something like this would give perspective.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, I'm going in. Forget this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are having this discussion, you watch as this beacon of pink hair emerges from the water next to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This smells weird. I really like it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this one of those sea monsters they were talking about?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It might be, yeah. I think that might have been the tentacle that Jester saw from--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have not seen the ocean--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's pretty nice, isn't it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The sunsets are gorgeous here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, man. I can't even imagine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should we stay here for the night?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we camp on the beach?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you want to see my mom, though?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we can camp on the beach before we leave town, but if people are anxious to get this done--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can go see my mom alone if you guys want to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we're going with you, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about tomorrow? Do you want to go tomorrow? Does she know you're coming?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Sending.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Mom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who are you talking to?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sort of in the wat-- at the beach right now. Well, not in the water, but I was wondering if you're singing tonight or if you're singing tomorrow--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (buzzer)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue talking, the voice creeps through and goes, "Jester, I only received a "portion of what you were saying, but I am singing tonight. Are you nearby?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (excited gasp) My mom is singing tonight, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, then we should leave the beach and go to where she is singing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Agreed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She doesn't sing every night, you know, so if we miss it, we might miss it for a while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this a headlining, prime time night? Or does she get the off nights and matinées?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's a special occurrence when she performs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, really? We're very fortunate, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It also occurs to me, this is an eastern ocean, isn't it? So it would be a sunrise or a sunset for this ocean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This side of the coast, it would be-- because where you are on the ocean, it would be setting in the west.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which, we have more than one sun, though, right? There's multiple suns in the sky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have multiple moons.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get the map! Where's the map?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need an orrery now to figure this out. I'm very excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the Menagerie Coast, the sun does set in the ocean.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay. West coast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, we should definitely go see Jester's mom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Without a doubt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Listen, the ocean will be here and we've got plenty of time to come back and fish, all sorts of stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, good, we can come back then later. That's great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, I can feel the disappointment--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because I didn't make it in today!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It'll be that much more special.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we can buy some new swimwear while we're in town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or any swimwear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because I think your bandages might come off in the water.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll get you some floaties.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They will help me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. They'll sink you like a stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, Nott, you also have that fabulous ring. You could just walk out onto the ocean.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, but I don't know how that works on moving water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should find out!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seems like it could be potentially hilarious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we want to get a good seat, though, I feel like we should leave now. I need to be up front because I can't see over people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we should probably get going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough, it is getting dark. Let's dry off, get our clothes back on, and get moving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys gather your things, dusk has set in, and now the sky shifts from light blue to a deep blue and purple on the eastern side as the oranges, reds, yellows, and pinks begin to overtake the western side of the skyline.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it do this every night? Wow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I feel a little robbed. It's just gray and rainy where I'm from, all the time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Guess you should have come here sooner.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But you get amazing storms, right? Thunder, lightning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. It snows a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It gets foggy here sometimes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah. We have fog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The closest thing I've experienced to this is inside Jester's backpack. In the dodecahedron.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I thought you meant the abyss of my backpack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's exactly what I thought, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There was a lot of baked goods in there, yeah. Now it's just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you high? Are you high on the ocean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's just the jellyfish sting taking effect.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. It's a good day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long of a drive is it-- of a cart ride is it to the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you heading back to the main road, to one of the entrances to the eastern gate of the city? Or are you heading towards the coastline to the actual wharf itself?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whatever way is faster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably the wharf.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do the wharf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is specifically marked off. There is an archway there that is gated by two of the guards that run the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Disguise Self before we get up there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Halt! What is your business in Nicodranas?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We came to see the Ruby of the Sea perform tonight, ha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one at the front, you can see beneath his helmet, which has these two bits of chainmail that curl open like curtains on each side of his face. He pulls them out of the way and looks forward towards the rest of the crew there. You can see his darker skin and his thick brow, it's almost like a unibrow that sits over sun-dried lips that are a bit cracked and parched. He glances forward, looks over the rest of you and goes, "The Ruby of the Sea?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll use the red dice for the Ruby. 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? Okay. He goes, "All right, and where do you hail from?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We hail from Port Damali.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Port Damali is from the other side, but it's fine. He goes, "All right. It's roundabout. And "you are?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am Fiona Fancypants! Theater critic extraordinaire!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now make a deception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That fell out of my hands, it doesn't count. Oh, it's the same roll! Shit. Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you want to enter, you have to enter from the main gates."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, but she's performing soon, and we're going to miss it if we go all the way around!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, then you'll have to find some way to make it through the gate." He holds his hand out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's see how much I have. I have five gold to put in his hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You put five gold in his hand?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a lot of gold, isn't it. I don't know, here you go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a number of warehouses and small huts and buildings that are built both on the dock and built along the side of where it adjusts from stone and sand into wood and elements that turn into the docks themselves. You can see tall cranes made of wood and cord and rope, some of them ten feet, some of them 25-30 feet or so, that are in the process of either loading or off-loading various materials from the trade ships that are making their way into harbor or loading up to leave in the morning. You see two or three larger guild buildings that tend to be the hubs of information for those that are coming from the docks. There are a few dockmasters that are walking around who are in the process of taking down information of who it is entering or exiting with their ships, making sure that everything is being handled, and you see a number of zhelezo that are also keeping a close eye. Torches are now lit as the sky grows darker, and there's one that's going through the city and lighting the actual oil lanterns that hang on these tall, thin poles that dot the city that have to be lit at dusk. One thing that does catch your eye is, right towards the center of this harbor where the Restless Wharf would be transitioning into what you know as the Open Quay, which is the other half of this harbor, there is a massive lighthouse that sits on this one bit of rock that protrudes where the docks come to an end and an element of the stone floor continues out before breaking off into a shelf into the ocean below. You can see this beautiful lighthouse. You know it as the Mother's Lighthouse. It catches your attention specifically, Caduceus, because the beautiful design of this lighthouse, while it seems natural and a gradual tower-like point on the back side, on the northern side, the southern side that faces the ocean has a 20-foot relief of the upper torso of a woman that is emerging from the lighthouse looking out over the ocean. A beautiful sculpture with wild hair that tangles and curls around the shoulders and then merges in with the stonework of this lighthouse, but what's unique is the way the lighthouse itself is placed as it rotates. As the light beacon comes across, you watch as the eyes of the woman flare up as the light passes that side of the tower. You recognize, the closer you get to this area, this large sculpture is that of the Wildmother, of Melora. That is where the Mother's Lighthouse title comes from.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long has it been here for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As long as I've been alive. I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is how long again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't know how old I am, Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it would have been obvious. And I turn around and walk away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That being the case--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is all very familiar to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you've spent a bit of time here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've been here before?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When did you meet each other? You and Jes?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, just on our way up into--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, a few weeks ago.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were near each other for a while and didn't know each other?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he grew up in a whole different city.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'm from Port Damali, but I had seen her a couple times in the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, only after I left here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far is Port Damali from here, roughly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's quite a distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's on like the other side of the--? The lower part of the continent?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, along the Menagerie Coast, Port Damali is the westernmost port city, which is why it's the largest here. It's the major hub of trade between all the western bits of civilization-- Tal'Dorei, Marquet, Issylra-- with the port town Nicodranas being the furthest east. The two of those mark the two endpoints, the bookends of the Menagerie Coast. There are a few other port towns in between, but they're smaller by comparison, and Nicodranas is about half the size of Port Damali.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. As we're walking through to make it to Jester's mom's place, any familiar faces catching eyes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine. Everyone seems to be going about their business. You are drawing some attention from folks as it is their job, there are a few zhelezo that keep an eye as you pass by. You see one male dwarf figure that appears to probably be the Wharfmaster who has a number of people talking to him, who watches you pass by, and as he does so he scribbles something in a book and then goes about his business, but that's the most you notice. You pass beyond the Restless Wharf heading north-northwest into the city, eventually the hustle and bustle of the docks begin to fade, the warehouses begin to slowly diminish their overtaking of the central business area of the city, and you come upon a large, 15-foot tall stone archway. It's a gradual arch as opposed to being straight and then turning over, it's a slow, gradual arch there with a large gem embedded at its peak, at its zenith.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Opal Archway!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Opal Archway?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are eleven of these throughout the district.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One of the Opal Archways? Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These, if you were to recount what information of history you know about the city here, the Opal Archways once marked the-- goddamn it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, you go. I'll just repeat it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Never mind, you don't get lore! I can give and I can take away! No, the Opal Archways mark what were the original boundaries of the city when it was first founded, and the city has expanded far beyond that, but that now marks the richer, most lively district where a lot of the political elite, where a lot of diplomats, and the wealthy merchants come to either live and/or spend their money. You pass beyond this archway, the original, occasional set poles that hold the oil lanterns that give the faint bit of flickering firelight through these dark cobblestone streets give way to much more vibrant, magical baubles that hover about ten feet above the air. They've already been set, and you see them give off a brighter glow, and the colors seem to shift. One of them has a whiter color but then slowly turns to an orange, then shifts to a green. About ten feet away on the other side of the street, you see another one that's colors are shifting but in a different pattern, so they're kind of complementing and also contrasting each other. At this point, too, you begin to see the streets-- while not as crowded as the wharf, people that are here are much better dressed. You see a carriage make its way by to your right, and you see a few folks that appear to be well-dressed nobles of some kind, wearing a crushed silk-type clothing that is bright blues and purples, and jewelry of all sorts of gems and colors. Compared to a lot of the drab decor that a lot of the noble families wear in your experiences up in the Empire, the cultural mishmash that tends to build here on the coast over time with so many people coming from so many places, it all has built this mixing pot of styles and ideas and self-expression, and it immediately is visible in the people that live here. You do notice, strangely, that there are a few townsguard among the zhelezo here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Townsguard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Crownsguard. Crownsguard of the Empire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, but we're not in the Empire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they look like they're working, or do they look like they're--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the Vegas of the Dwendalian Empire, where it's close enough they can go travel to and still enjoy a bit of comfort and some semblance of home in places, but it's still different and alien and unique enough to the point where it feels like a vacation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can tell from their posture that they're not on leave; they're actually there more on duty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're more on duty, though you're not sure if it's their own duty or if they've been given some sort of post specifically by whoever's paying them. But it catches the rest of you who aren't familiar with this sight a little off-guard, and you immediately adjust your posture and get into a little more of a naturally defensive position, knowing that there is now two forces of law enforcement now looking to the streets of the Archways.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's okay, most of the crownsguard here don't really give a shit. When they get stationed out here, they're like, "Okay, okay" and they do the fun stuff too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's more of a cush posting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they give these postings to people who are fuck-offs? Or do they give these postings to people who are--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, they're pretty legit. Because honestly, this is where the bigwigs go, so they want the best, right? They're not going to take a bunch of jack-offs with them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Got you. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So there's a lot of people with jewelry around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was just thinking, I felt a little underdressed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I steal some for you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, here's the thing. You can steal stuff if you want, Nott, but the laws are enforced a little bit stricter here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's some hefty penalties. Everything from stealing to murder puts you away for quite a while, and it's a hefty fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I won't steal or murder, then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That whole spectrum in between. You can fill in everything that happened in your mind when I said those two. It applies to that shit as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What else is there, really, between stealing and murder?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Arson?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's a good one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kidnapping?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we talking about things in between?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, in between those two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So what about mail fraud? Is mail fraud in there, or is it lesser than stealing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the worst. That's the worst crime there is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No one talks to anyone that commits mail fraud.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You are all accomplices. I just want to point that out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When Caleb and I were in the clink, there was a guy in there who had committed mail fraud.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was fucked up by every other prisoner in there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They don't like them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marked for death.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't fuck with the postal service.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! That's sacred.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We were the only two people in that cell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Were you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (coughing) That is correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still got saltwater from where Fjord goosed you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I shouldn't have surprised you, man, I'm sorry about that. Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, that's on you, buddy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry. You've got to-- nah, I'm not going to say it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In passing further through the Opal Archways district, you begin to hear the music of various street buskers and performers beginning to take to the roads. They have their own lighting arrangements, and you see a small-- what's the word for it? A topped cart, a vardo. Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was right on the tip of my tongue.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was on the tip of mine, but that's fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most everyone in the street doesn't pay them mind, occasional silver is tossed their way. Passing that still, you go by a building that catches your attention immediately. This gaudy, nearly a palace of an estate. You see this large building, white silk-draped, dull brass and orange-yellow stone, a sandstone base construct of a building. You know this. You've passed it before, but you're uncertain. This is the Marquis Demesne. This is where the Marquis of the city lives.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marquis Demesne.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Even at a glance, you can see that there's probably well over 40 rooms within this establishment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We get lots of visitors all the time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's a big house, like a mansion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lot of money has gone into its construction, and the closer you get to it, you can see that maybe it's not in the best of upkeep. But what you do notice is that the presence of Zhelezo is very strong. There's probably about 20 or more zhelezo that are in the process of keeping an eye on the vicinity, walking around the boundaries of the exterior of the Demesne. You can see eight or so that are stationed at the front, and a few that are walking along the upper parapets or high walls, keeping an eye down on the street.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it seem like the same amount that's always been there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It can vary, but you get the sense-- Make a history check, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that there's probably a handful of diplomats that are staying there as guests, and that's why the guard is a little more heightened than normal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) There's probably diplomats there tonight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wartime.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you curve around the bend of the exterior of Demesne, you see before you what is considered the high-end inn of the Opal Archways. You see this beautiful, three-story, thin but very tall building of soft, sky blue pigment that's been painted across the stone, and each windowsill you can see this gold-leafed wooden frame, that dangling from it is a deep cerulean, crushed velvet curtain that open up across glass windows that appear to be stained glass, and glowing from the inside, emanate this slightly shifting kaleidoscope of color from the inside out. The steps that lead up to the front double doors, which are currently open, emanate a very soft sound of music: a four, five piece band, apparently, playing gentle, atmospheric music to the interior. This is a very familiar sight to you, Jester, as this is the Lavish Chateau. This is where you grew up. This is your home.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She hasn't started yet! You guys!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hear music; is that the warm-up act?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, but if you don't hear singing, she hasn't gone yet!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we have to pay to get in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No? I never had to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you lived there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So yeah, it's probably free.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this a hotel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You grew up in a hotel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I mean, it wasn't a hotel to me. We had a lot of the top floor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But under normal circumstances, because you look this way, but would everyone know you here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You mean like as a human? Or would they know me as a me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As Jester. Do they know you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, yeah, of course they would.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you don't want them to see you, so how will we get in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I'm disguised.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, but how will we get in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What was your name again? Fiona Fancypants?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Just Fiona.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know Disguise Self lasts an hour, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Has it been an hour?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been over an hour. But I'll say that you've kept it up, but mark off two more 1st-level spell slots for the time it's taken to travel since you arrived at the ocean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, two more since-- wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From traveling from the ocean to the city, and making your way through, it's been the better part of an hour, so it would be two spell slots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, a little over an hour since you left the beach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just recast it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Well, then, how are we going to get in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I don't even look like me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to Disguise Self, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do they check weapons at the door, anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you recall, they request weapons be noted. You can keep a weapon on your person, as a means of self-defense, but you cannot come in fully decked out, ready for armor. You can have one small personal item on yourself as a means of self-defense. Everything else can be kept at a coat room at the entrance. You also do see two zhelezo that are stationed on either side of the open doorway that is part of the protective presence here at the inn and the higher-end customers that they see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before entering, I would look for an alleyway in the last few minutes before getting here to make all of my clothes look-- I cast Disguise Self on myself, and don't change my appearance other than to make my clothes look brand new and slightly more expensive than they are.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may join you in that, if that's all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By all means.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll also humanize myself and put together something that looks appropriate for the sort of people I've seen walking around. Lot of pearlescent whites and greens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, this'll go poorly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're still very tall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He can adjust his height.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One foot up and down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's part of the Disguise Self ability that he has.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it was just a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's a racial trait of a firbolg.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Straight intelligence check? 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see, with the same pink hair-- how would you like to be dressed?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Definitely the same pink hair, but tied back. He's a thin, adult human man who's got a little bit of a scruff going into a bit of a shaggy goatee. If this is appropriate for it, a little bit of the French Restoration, but nice, pale, opalescent whites.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I keep imagining Lord Strider.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god. Okay, yes, that's fair. It's muted, but fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will also cast Disguise Self and turn into a female dwarf with a simple muumuu.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A simple what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A muumuu.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't insult my dignity; just give me the muumuu!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you almost look like one of the ghosts from Pac-Man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A blue muumuu.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, perfect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that Blinky? I think that was Blinky.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach and begin to step out of the cart, you see a young human man in his early 20s or so, his hair gelled back, but it tends to curl up and poof a bit towards the base and around the sides of his neck. He's wearing a vest with a plain but well-made silk white shirt and a pair of trousers. You recognize him as Tyral. He is essentially the front hand of the inn. As he approaches, he looks up to you. "Are you leaving your cart here? Are you going to be staying?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, we're going to be staying here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Well, I will see that this is taken care of. Please, enter."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you board animals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We can. There is a charge."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool. Here's the pigeon he's been eating.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seagull.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, it's a seagull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Um." Sets it on the railing of the stairway on the side, and goes, "Very well. I will see and "tend to the horses and your hawk?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Professor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's an owl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ow! Ow! Ow!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That sucks!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is that for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Other pets?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's for money.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is actually to pay for the service."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here. I pay him. How much is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't say. How much do you give him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For the service of boarding the animals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Boarding the animals and taking care of the cart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give him five gold, because I saw Jester do that earlier and it seems to be the common courtesy of Nicodranas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You drop five gold in his hand, and his eyes go wide. He's like, "Oh, of course!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was that a lot of money?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right this way!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For this particular thing, I think it was.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a lot of happiness, and that's okay!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like we're really well off, though, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems to be immediately swallowing the pain from the talons that are grinding into his forearm, and is now smiling brightly and eager to please the new arrivals on the outskirts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's more where that came from if you take good care of them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lighten up a bit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about the other animals?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're staying with me. I'm not giving these things up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're walking in with a dog and a weasel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, the weasel is tucked in, so really no one will notice it. But yes, I'm walking in with a dog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's like a lap dog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My mom will want to meet him!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Okay!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The dog's going to piss everywhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, blink dogs don't pee.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a rule. It's canon!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you named the weasel yet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she's saying this, a dark spot is slowly spreading across.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! You just got peed on! Beautiful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His name is Sprinkle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sprinkle?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sprinkle the weasel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a male.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I named the seagull in my head, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Steven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be a Steven.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Steven Seagull.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Steven Seagull. That's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yes! I got to give it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's maybe nine patrons that are currently in the tavern, but those that are in here are very well dressed. They're clustered around three separate tables: three, three and three at three different tables.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm a heathen. What is dupioni silk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dupioni silk. It's a type of silk material that has an interesting texture to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll show you at the break!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was just curious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really pretty. It's basically the nicest kind you can get. It's really fancy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it like the velour Juicy sweatpants that I saw when I first moved here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to Google it! Dip-i-- how do you spell it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody at home gets out their swatch they got.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks a little rougher than just smooth silk. It has a bit of a texture to it, and it looks a little more natural.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Legitimately just curious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's shiny. It's shiny silk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You said with those nine people that are in the room, how many tables are there about?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bob Dupioni.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly! You see ten tables in the room total.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten tables.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a carpeting that is draped over the center, about eight-foot wide down the staircase, that is a similar light blue color as the paint on the exterior of the building.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Isn't it pretty?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I used to run up and down these stairs late at night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ruby-- what's your mom's name? What do we call her? Miss Lavore? Mrs. Lavore?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or Marion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marion? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is blue the predominant color here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the exterior, yes. On the interior, it's a light tan and medium wood tint with whites and gold and silver.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fiona, do you recognize anyone in this room?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do. Sure, I recognize that bartender and that bartender and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I meant the patrons. Anybody that--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yep. A couple of them have been upstairs, if you know what I mean.

lines.name: TALIESIN
