lines.text: I don't!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Her mother is a lady of the night.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah! Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The lady of the night, if you will!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's the best lay ever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and considering that she's singing tonight, it seems really empty in here! What's that about?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's a private show?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She doesn't do that. It would cost a lot of money!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, maybe it wasn't publicized. Maybe it's a surprise drop-in show.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys have been standing in the middle of the foyer area, you're pushed ahead by another group of about four individuals. They look to be merchants, well-dressed for the occasion, and they push passed. "Ah, excuse me." They go and find another table, and you get the sense that the room probably is going to be filling up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably get a table as soon as possible. Where's the backstage door? Where do I get to my mom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your mom actually descends for her performance, so you'd have to go upstairs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to go upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Just you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys all find a table?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Is it better near the front, or in the back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, she comes down from those stairs, so make sure you got a good view of that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll get as close to the stairs as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You run up to the secondary floor, where there are a number of various rooms for the inn that are for rent. You head up the next flight of stairs. As they both meet in the center, there's this second flight that mirrors the bottom floor parallel on the floor upward. That one splits again on the top floor, and there, as you get to the third and final floor of the chateau, on the left side there are a number of inn doors, but there is one doorway that is made of a different wood grain than the rest of them. It was a gift from a very interested suitor years ago and it has been installed, but it marks the chamber where the Ruby of the Sea makes her home, and for most of your life until recently, you made yours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go up to it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You go up to the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We stay downstairs, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I buy the group a round.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aw!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hear, muffled through the doorway, a little bit of practiced singing. Some scales, some "La la la la la!" You hear other voices talking and there's some rustling moving through. Someone seems to stub a toe and goes, "Ow! We're trying--!" And there's a few other people rushing around in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I knock on the door and say: Good evening, Marion Lavore! The Little Sapphire has come to see you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glances past. Her name is-- actually, let me look it up. Nadine. She peeks through, looking at you, "I'm terribly sorry, what did you say?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm here to see the Ruby of the Sea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, she is going to be performing shortly."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, tell her that I'm here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She is not--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, tell her. Tell her. (shouting) The Little Sapphire's here to see you, Ruby!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a voice from behind her go, "I'm sorry, what?" From peeking over her shoulder as your vision focuses into the chamber beyond, low lit beyond the series of candles that are set around the single mirror. You see the beautiful red skin of your mother and the dark hair tumbled past the shoulder as she's been wearing a mostly laced up bodice, as the other servant is in the process of lacing and tying it. Glances over her shoulder and pushes past the edge of the chair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see her smile brightly, her faintly white glowing hint of yellowish-gold tint to her eyes brighten immediately and goes, "Well, come in! Please, close the door."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Excuse me, Nadine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nadine closes the door and goes, "I'm very confused by this, Mistress, but whatever you "require." At which point, the other one who's lacing is still pulling on the back of the bodice, and without even looking at her Marion pushes her aside, "Shh."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I run forward and give her a big hug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you give her a hug, she holds you there and goes, "You look different."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) It's a spell! I'm actually still me, don't worry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a nod and the tension in her body melts as her arms close around your shoulders and back and pulls you in close. This moment of warmth and relief that washes over both of you and being reunited here in this chamber. The two servants sit in the back, awkwardly not quite understanding entirely either and whispering to each other, while Marion continues to hold you and rock you back and forth. "My beautiful Jester, I have missed you so much."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I missed you so much! I wanted to come home sooner, but we got distracted because we went to the Empire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I remember you telling me you telling me you were going to go there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh that's right, I sent you messages! Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How was it? I have not traveled beyond the boundaries."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really cold and the people are pretty strict, but there's some really nice people that you can meet. I met a lot of friends! You should meet them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'd be happy to."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're downstairs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She traces her fingers down your face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here! I put her hand on my horn so she can tell it's there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She feels it. "Can I see my little girl?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it okay with--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're fine." You drop the illusion and even though she knew, it wasn't until she gets an opportunity to look upon your face, and your hair, and your eyes, and your smile that you watch life breathe in like a renewed fire into the chest of your mother. Immediately she grabs the sides of your cheeks and pulls you in, "I've missed you so much." Brings you in, and kisses you on the forehead, and starts running her fingers through your hair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be careful of the weasel. His name is Sprinkle, Mama.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He is very adorable."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to say I left Nugget downstairs with you guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: After he peed on you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She immediately starts brushing your hair with her fingers on the side, "You've gone so far "and traveled so much. You have to tell me about what you've done."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will of course! Do you want me to finish lacing you up? Your performance is tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, it is, please. Do not mind, she knows what to do." Now in front of the mirror with you behind her, she's looking at you through the mirror over her shoulder as you're helping lace up the back of her bodice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We went to a town, and it was burned down and we killed a bunch of gnolls and we took off their ears. Then we went to another city and we fought these fish people in this swamp and it was really crazy. Oh my gosh, you should meet this monk girl that I know. She's crazy and she fights with her fists and also with a staff and she's really strong. There's this other girl who has wings. And I tell her all about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would never have thought my little Jester "would be seeing the world and fighting creatures."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fighting so much; you should see how strong I've gotten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I want to see how strong you've gotten."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I mean, okay. Do you want me to punch you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps, wait until after the performance? I've just applied my-- anyway." At that point she stands up and Nadine helps her put the rest of her dress on. It's this beautiful deep purple, satin-type material. It's low-cut with this beautiful, long, training sleeve that hangs down past her knees when her arms are at her side. Puts on her necklace, a faint velvet choker that pulls across the back of the neck there and in the center is a small blue gem that she keeps to remind herself of you. She takes a moment to look in the mirror, "Well, how do I look?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You look beautiful, Mama.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then perhaps you should go join your friends."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh right, I can't disguise myself anymore, though. Can I borrow a cloak or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps." You can technically spend higher spell slots to cast a lower level spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to, it's up to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, that's all that I'll do. I'll cast it again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're going to see a show, what could happen?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All my spell slots. Okay. I run back downstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We still have Caduceus. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's almost ready! She's so beautiful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's great! Was she happy to see you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no, of course she was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is she going to give us a place to stay tonight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure! Yes, of course she is. Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: While we've been sitting down there, I have not disguised the way I look. Any glances, looks, anybody we recognize? Anybody lingering on us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hoping that maybe you'll recognize their status as higher.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, we're here. We are here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I make myself look real big. Put my staff out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Feet up on the other chair?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, holding the chair for Jester.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Move on, friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They eventually make their way to the opposite side of the room, perpetually throwing stink-eye in your direction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we in the front, or the middle, or the back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys, I believe, took a table near the stairs, which would be on the right side, probably, for a table that was available. Looking from the entrance you came, so it would be on the northeastern side of the building.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. How big an audience space is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's ten tables.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roughly how many people are crammed in here, at a guess?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten tables is a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, throughout the interior of this whole chamber, you probably have, now including yourselves, close to 50 to 60 people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They come with their own Zhelezo bodyguards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are they there? The two people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there is a couple that is currently situated on one of the central tables.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do they look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both their attire seems to be more Dwendalian than Menagerie Coast. At least in the styles that they are wearing, though they do have two Zhelezo that are hired and keeping a watch at the table.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester. You recognize those stuffy pants people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I've never seen them before. Have you eaten any of this cheese? It's really good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but we got you two milks because there's a two drink minimum.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drinks have been ordered to your specifications of the table, and the drinks here are expensive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I covered that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's rare that you get rounds here; you either get high end liquors or bottles of wine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Table service.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever is expected here, Caleb covers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That will cost you approximately--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One platinum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Almost, six gold. For two bottles of wine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, so generous, Caleb. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the liquor, it would be six gold. For the two bottles of wine, it's ten gold apiece. So 26 gold total.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I told you I was rich.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you tip in the Menagerie Coast? Is there tipping?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you tip here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In the Menagerie Coast tipping, five percent? Ten percent?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know, do you tip here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The whole fucking society is based off of tipping.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But Caleb does not not know that and does not tip. He has no experience with any of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just like a Zemnian.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The doors are closed on the other side of the chamber. The band brings their song to a close. A bit of a murmur takes the quiet room as the lights shift. The candles that were all that warm, yellowish orange light, suddenly, all at once, reduce to a low, red flicker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is exciting. I should've peed before the show started.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I never really get to watch from down here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is exciting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shouting)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so ready. I'm ready for it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sings Get Ready 4 This)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Y'all ready for this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now coming to the stage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to take a quick break, for us and for you folks. We're having our giveaway tonight, our Wyrmwood giveaway!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whip it out; how's it look?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fantastic dice tower set made from cherry wood right here. We got the Raven's Call cartography from our friend, Deven Rue. That's some amazing work there. It is beautiful! It's the whole magnetic set where you can assemble your dice tower, with a little dice box and that. In order to enter, you have to jump over to the Critical Role Twitch, that's twitch.tv/criticalrole and in the chatroom enter the code word "pets." P-E-T-S. One time only; more than once and you'll be disqualified.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't want to go with Professor Thaddeus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see you guys here in a few minutes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, everyone. We have our winner of the fantastic Wyrmwood giveaway. The person who won is fourpony. Fourpony, congratulations.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fourpony?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, as in F-O-U-R-P-O-N-Y. Fourpony.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You always want a little fore-pony before the pony.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fore-pony is important. Congratulations, fourpony. We'll get that information and get this sent out to you ASAP. Well done! Wanted to remind you folks also as we are two minutes away from the drop of the Waterdeep: Dragon Heist adventure being available within D&D Beyond. For those that aren't aware, not only is it a cool new adventure, but a lot of great people got to work on it and I had the opportunity to consult on the Dragon Heist, helping flesh out villains and factions and story elements there. It was a lot of fun to work with the team. Super proud of it, there's some fun bits in the book. I hope you guys'll enjoy. You have, as of now, one minute! 60 seconds from being able to get it. So look for it ASAP.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) D&D!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Click on the site, cover your body in blood, download it right away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The proper way to celebrate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) D&D Beyond!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she passes by, she glances off to one of the assistants who rushes over and scoops them off the table. She does not accept the tips herself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nevertheless, for those of you who this is your first time here within the Lavish Chateau, this is definitely one of the most beautiful performance you've seen, and you immediately see why Jester's mother, why The Ruby of the Sea, or at least one of the many reasons that she's renowned across these lands. As she completes the piece, she ascends back up the stairs, back to her chambers, vanishing from sight. As everyone within stands up, and begins clapping and cheering.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Brava.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I see it. Yeah, nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll put it in post.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, the doors open to the backside of the inn. Some folks begin to saunter out, their performance that they've come to see for the evening complete. Others go back to their meal, and their drinks and their conversation. Some individuals begin to approach the bartenders and eagerly ask for, what you know to be, the availability for companionship that the Ruby has for the evening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good luck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dude, Jester's mom has got it going on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was really... something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She was so good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Isn't she wonderful?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So much poise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's hurting my heart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can't even watch ASPCA commercials.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I got to look at it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She was amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, how much does she make for a performance like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I don't know. We never counted it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does she only work on tips, or does she also get paid from the venue, or is that--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I mean, she lives here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But she gets paid for other things, and the tips from the singing. The singing pulls in the other things. You know what I mean.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was mesmerizing, Jester. I mean, she really had an effect on the room. Was it just me, or did the lights seem to dance when she was singing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's her Thaumaturgy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do. I make the lights flare just a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of the patrons stop and look towards the stairs to see if she's coming back down again, and then (sigh).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep your pants on!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Making them want an encore, huh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you all in love with her now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's a striking woman.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stunning.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very impressive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would she sing with you, when you're alone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well yeah, she sang to me all the time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you sing with her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes. Mostly it was just her, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you ever wish you could do what she does?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be that pretty, and graceful, and sing really good, and have a bunch of people think she's wonderful?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, of course not! I like myself just the way I am.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think you're pretty and graceful and pretty graceful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Beau.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your singing voice is nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Fjord. When did you hear me sing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you first told us about your mother.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So that's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The night isn't over yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That happened at the last show we went to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, big scary dude.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh that's right. Man, that was our first--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Show, first show.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you want to spend more time with your mother? Did you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would assume so, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, of course. Usually, after the performance is taken by other things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nevertheless, he storms down the stairs, his two dwarven bodyguards leaving along with him. They end up exiting the inn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He didn't look very happy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he did not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singsong) He probably got turned away, because my mom was already taken.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How does she figure out who's going to be the customer? Is it a lottery, or a wait list system?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's kind of a wait list, but usually she only has, you know, a few patrons during any given period of time. So she'll have the best diplomats that come to town and if they've claimed that time then they can spend time with her for an entire week or even more and nobody else will come to see her. You know what I mean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does she have to deal with a lot of jealous suitors?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes. There's a lot of people that want to marry her, and have tried to court her and stuff like that. But she only ever, you know, said yes to my dad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This place seems, you know, pretty well--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, there's lot of security guards around here, unfortunately.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, should we leave her in peace? If she has work to do, we should leave.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there a time of the day or the week that you would have mother-daughter time?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes I would already be asleep, but she'd come in and say, "I'm just saying good night to "you, love." Then she would go, and then we'd wake up, and sometimes we'd have breakfast, but sometimes we wouldn't and then sometimes she was gone for a few days at a time because the people here, they don't really want to know about their daughters or anything like that. So I would stay hidden, she would tell me to, and then sometimes she'd be free and then we could have lunch or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sounds fine. Sounds normal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we'd all like to meet her. Would tomorrow be the time for that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not going to waste a spell slot. I'm just going to run upstairs and tell Nadine to not disturb my mom, but to ask if it's okay if I come by tomorrow, maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Nadine opens the room, "Actually your mother--" and opens the door and your mom, who has taken the dress off and has currently put on a comfortable robe, turns and goes, "Jester, I have "taken no suitors this evening, so we can spend it together."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What! Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've said you wanted me to meet your friends. I want to hear their stories and I need "to say thank you to those who've kept my little girl safe."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mama, that's so wonderful. I'll be right back. Can they come upstairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, of course."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know if we can stay here tonight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you are welcome to stay in your room, if you like. I can definitely have rooms arranged "for all of you, if you would prefer."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll see what they think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Whatever you prefer, my dear."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I turn back around and go running back upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we supposed to follow? Okay, we follow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys head all upstairs, and eventually make your way to the third landing and the chamber's open, and there Nadine's waiting and escorts you in. Beautiful chambers, with a large canopy bed. You can see silks in the windows that have elements of gems and beads knitted into these braided cords that you can imagine during the daylight would add bits of colored speckles throughout the chamber. You see a balcony that overlooks the entirety of the wharf below and also know this to be the balcony where Jester got in trouble. But there you can see within this--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Marquis Demesne.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's "mar-quiz."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Mar-quez."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Mar-quay-ee."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Faintly white, yellow gold eyes. The horns that curl backwards and then shift off to the sides abruptly before curving back a little bit. It's this beautiful curl that extenuates the way her hair falls behind. It gives this wreath and a crowned look to her. This regal presentation even when she's just wearing comfortable robes. As you all enter one by one, she goes, "Please, know that "you are guests of me here within this. Call this your home for as long as you'd like to stay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could stay here forever if we wanted to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think that's what she means.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please, I would like to the know the names. If you would like to introduce?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is Fjord. I meet him earliest. He's a half-orc and he's growing his teeth back and he's very handsome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can see that."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a pleasure. I can see where Jester gets her good looks from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I can see where she speaks honestly in front of her mother as well." She puts her hand out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll give it a kiss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can see you are a very strong-willed and protective man. Do you watch over Jester "in my stead?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do. I try to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. I feel better knowing that she's safe in your care. Anyway."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is Beau. She's really strong. She's the one I was telling you about that can fight things with a stick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. You mentioned that earlier. Beau, it is a pleasure."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She reaches and shakes your hand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also kiss her hand. Do the finger tip thing back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The pleasure is mine as well."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is Caleb. He's a wizard. He has a lot of fire and stuff. He likes his books and he used to smell bad, but he doesn't anymore. He likes water now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have a beautiful singing voice. Thank you very much for the performance. You have a very charming daughter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that a Zemnian accent?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am afraid so, ja.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It shows that you've traveled some distance to be here. I appreciate that."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fish out of water, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you've found plenty of it here. So perhaps the fish has found a home."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's good. She's very good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is Nott. She's very very brave, even though she's very small. Be careful of your rings.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wouldn't steal from your mother, and if I did, we would solve the crime.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right! Because we are detectives and we're really good at solving cases. She's my partner in crime.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I was not aware this was the dress of a detective."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Am I still in my--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will drop my form.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) This is what she really looks like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes a step back. "Oh!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't apologize."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Always with the teeth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Love his hands.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is seagull blood, this is not human blood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The world is made of all kinds."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you need an extra seagull or two, I have seven to spare and I would happily leave you one or two of those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They are the rats of the city. I have had plenty, but I thank you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They sure are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I think you are very adorable. It is a pleasure to meet you, Nott."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: See? You are adorable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, she's very nice. It's lovely to meet you. I'll curtsy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She grabs the edges of her robe and counter-curtsies halfway, while she's sitting in her chair. "And this one, this--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And this is Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I pop back up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (louder) And he drinks dead people tea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Interesting."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The pleasure is mine. You've not been outside of this graveyard that my daughter speaks of?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only recently, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A man fresh to the world of vice, I presume?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aware of it, but just trying to only dip a couple toes in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, my daughter will break you of any habits of ignorance very quickly."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what that means.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would like to know what that means?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You carry very interesting companions."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I've saved theirs because I'm a really good cleric. Did you know that I do that now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I did not!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can heal people, Mom!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is incredible!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She can heal people. She is able to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's been very helpful in a few frays. We owe her quite a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I am grateful that you all have kept her safe. I'm excited to hear that you've been "able to do such incredible things! Is this your friend that you mentioned before? The Traveler?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no he's not here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but the healing."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The healing? Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wow! Oh, very well! Well, that is incredible."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I-- Here, let's have some drinks." The servants begin to uncork the wine and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you prefer to drink?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To be honest? That one." She points to one of the two bottles that were brought up. As opposed to the smooth wine bottle, this has a faceted gem-type crystal design to it. The cork itself has a deep crimson ribbon that's tied around it. There's a little wax seal placed upon it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh hold on, let me go get the aerator.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, what's that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is two new songs that I have requested "written that should be completed by the end of the year."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) I can't wait to hear them!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't wait to perform them for you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happened with Lord Sharpe? Did he cause too much of a stink?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have been working to try and get those charges eliminated, but it is a difficult process. He is a "man who-- his pride is very important to him. So in time. But for now, perhaps just do more of what "you've been doing to not look like yourself once you leave this space."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hypothetically, if he were to pass away, would the trial charges disappear with him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "I mean, yes. But I would not insinuate such a dark thing."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, remember what we talked about? Criminal penalties--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's murder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that's one. A1. Bingo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's on scale. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We do really good things most of the time, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, what has brought you here? I mean, I'm happy to have you, but if you are just here to "see me perform, then I--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should show her the letter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes! We're solving a mystery.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, like remember we told you we were detectives.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're also here for some other Fjord things, but-- He has the letter. We're trying to figure out the provenance of this-- that's a detective word-- of this letter, and who wrote it, and who is it for and stuff. What's that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed. Would you mind if I asked your mom a few?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, not at all. Go for it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just because you're so well-established in this region, so well-known and connected as you mentioned, does the name Marius LePual ring any bells?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not directly, but I may be able to ask around."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, if it wouldn't be too much of an inconvenience.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would, perhaps--" She hands it back to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that letter say Evantica on it, also?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it says Evantica.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that name mean anything to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately no, I have not come across an Evantica."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about The Captain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are many captains here in the port. I apologize, but I know many."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ionos is another name mentioned in the letter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ionos is the time of year? No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. It's "many thanks to you." I think it's an I.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know an Ionos, either." You do recall that Ionos is a member of the Jagentoth family, up in Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that was the connection with who that letter was intended towards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To the Iron Shepherds. Right, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Another dead end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll figure it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps you could find somebody to help you out there. I will continue to ask around. I'm "being careful with my socialization these days."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please, we don't want to get you in any sort of trouble--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, It's no trouble, I just--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Socialization? Why, Mama?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've been having some problems with a client."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you talking about?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A burly fellow named Algar Dyomin."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Funny hair?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Kind of strange, interesting taste in presentation."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he the guy that was here tonight?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, kind of buff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is him, yes. He is very--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What was that last name, again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dyomin. D-Y-O-M-I-N. (sighs) "He's become very possessive. He has been a client of "mine a number of times. And while his conversation was on the duller scale of individuals I've been "with, he paid well and did not seem to bring a problem. But he has become more and more "possessive, and only in this past week, I've been hearing of him threatening and telling other clients "of mine to back away. I do not enjoy people threatening my clientele or my business. I have "twice now explained to him precisely the nature of our arrangement and relationship. That does not "seem to be enough for him. Now, the zhelezo of the chateau are my guardians, and they're very good "about keeping watch. I have my friends in the Archways, but the more I look into it, I believe "Algar works directly for the Concord within the city, so he is with his own powerful allies as well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Concord?

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS, LIAM
lines.text: The Clovis Concord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is my first time dealing with scenarios like this, but I'd prefer to avoid any "sort of direct confrontation, by any means necessary, any bloodshed within the Chateau." (sighs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We lure him outside of the Chateau, and then we kill him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want him to hurt you, Mom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you're trying to break up with him, you could tell him that you have the creepies, the crawlies down there, and that might scare him away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, rumors travel quickly?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that would ruin you for the other clients, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For some of them, perhaps."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Smart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are unable to speak to the law here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He has not broken the law. His friends in some places enforce the law. That is where "my conundrum lies."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What exactly does he do for the Clovis Conclave? Concord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps the Wharfmaster may know more."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we can get him to fall in love with someone else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That would be helpful. Though, I don't mean to brag, but good luck."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could just kick his ass, intimidate the shit out of him. Tell him he's not to fuck with you anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but that links it back to her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be careful how you dance around that."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, sure, discretion is appreciated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very much. The old woman of the lighthouse has been here for some time. Could ask her, perhaps."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The who?

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: The old woman in the lighthouse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone lives up there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, the keeper of it. The Lightkeeper."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does she have a name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Gladys, I think?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't mean to pry into your business too much, but are your appointments exclusively here, or have you ventured to his place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, they only meet here. It needs to be on my terms, it needs to be in my realm of safety."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Understood. Do you know where we might be able to find him? Does he say where he stays?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. He's also been braggadocious, but not forthcoming with personal information either, "which is unfortunately, a sign of, perhaps, dubious and/or dangerous business? He's told me "twice he wishes to one day show me his secret, his great servant beneath the city, but--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His great servant beneath the city?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sirens) Understood. I'm sure with a personality as large as his, it won't be too hard to find some information on him, some gentle poking around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just speaking hypothetically, it would not upset you any if he were to disappear?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Accidentally?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not be around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't believe he's done anything that would warrant anything too disastrous, but if he can be "ensured that his presence is not welcome and agrees that is the case, that would be optimal."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we will try our best to reach the optimum result.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know if there's a place where the lowlifes of the city like to congregate? The underground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Those two places, a lot of curious folk wander and celebrate. Fisticuff. It is not uncommon "to find bodies in alleys."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love celebrating fisticuffs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That you do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was his last name?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dyomin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Algard, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dyomin. Algar. A-L-G-A-R.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, I have to say, I don't feel any great rush to continue on out of the city until you at least feel that your mother is safe and protected.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really? You guys will stay here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please, I do not mean to impose my responsib--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mama! They're going to take care of you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester picked up the bill a lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's why I ran out of money. Thank you for sending that package, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. I'm sorry it took a little longer than anticipated."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no. It's fine!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You mentioned the lighthouse. Would we need anything to enter the lighthouse? Some token of familiarity, or some name that would get us a tour to meet the proper people there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have not met them directly, only heard of them."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gale?

lines.name: SAM, MATT
lines.text: Gladys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She's the Lightkeeper of the lighthouse. I know that she can be rather ornery, so perhaps you "need to win over her interest?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She is a bit older in human years, so be respectful, I guess."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are these interests you are referring to? Her interests, you said to our friend Mr. Clay here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know. I don't know what her interests are, but perhaps if you could find out, "or at least not make her extremely angry."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it is good that we have the world's two best detectives with us. That should be an easy task to fulfill.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You haven't seen us solve a crime yet, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We do a really good job.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester looks extremely motivated. Perhaps we taking care of this simple errand for you might help compensate for a few nights stay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do not require compensation, but if it makes you feel better about it, certainly. You're "quite the gentleman."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's actually not The Gentleman. We met a guy who goes by the name "Gentleman."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you heard of him, Mama?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, she's like-- oh okay, got it. I don't know who knows who.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dark hair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's wet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. He's always really wet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a wet walker.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A wet walker!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, I know of him."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know of The Gentleman? Is that a good thing or a bad thing, because we're not cool with him so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I know of a man of you describe, of blueish skin and quite sweaty. Yes, he has come "through before."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he nice, or was he not nice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He was very nice. He was very dashing."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I told you about him before."

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait a minute. But not The Gentleman, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know of the name 'The Gentleman,' but--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has dark hair. He's got black hair that's really long.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And blue skin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, your mother knows The Gentleman. That's so cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It goes a little deeper than that, Deucy. Is that--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's happening?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's why you always have a little sweat right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is why you can do watery stuff, right? Like cold stuff? Can you do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tell me more of this Gentleman, please."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, okay. Well, he lives in Zadash, and he lives in a bar, and he's got long black hair, and he's really charming, but kind of snarky at the same time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well dressed, smooth voice, little patch of dark hair on the chest right there?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Leaky Nip.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leaky Tap.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Leaky Tap! Not the Leaky Nip.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He wasn't in the Leaky Tap!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a very different place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have it in the other book!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Evening Nip.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the Gentleman. The Evening Nip!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, The Evening Nip is the name of that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, we're fighting over taverns.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god, we're freaking out! Keep it together!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have a gift for him or something? We have many gifts or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have nothing to offer, but we can provide many gifts.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He has a barkeep man named Clive Binz. He knows a guy around here, too, named Father Pierce.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know about anything in that regard, but he wasn't named The Gentleman when I met him."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What was he named?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I never asked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a vial of his spit. Can you analyze it? I don't know!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She smirks a bit and says, "Oh, honey."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He did wear lots of rings on his fingers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We had a bit of a romance years ago."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many years ago, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I told you about Babenon."

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Babenon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Babenon Dosaal."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't ask if that was his name, though!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your dad's name is Bob?! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: B-A-B.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, Bob Bobanon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: B-A-B-E-N-O-N.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bob Loblaw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bob Loblaw's Law Blog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have no idea what his name is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Babenon. Babenon Dosaal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, Babenon what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bob Babylon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You say he's in Zadash now?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you said he lived in the ocean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's what he told me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god. What if The Gentleman is my dad?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we saying if, or are we saying is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we don't know for sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your mother might know for sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a picture of him? Do you have a drawing of him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't you draw The Gentleman? You've probably got drawings of him in your book!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got a drawing of The Gentleman in my sketchbook!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the perfect time for a game of Pictionary. I'm so excited. Both of you, don't look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you draw one and she draws one!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then compare!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Draw off!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to think the party is legitimately this excited.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh hell yeah we are!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't understand what's happening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is the best episode of Maury ever!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Marion seems both present and not. She's trying to process all of this. She reaches over and goes to her counter and begins drawing. She's not anywhere as good an artist as her daughter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, this is pure gold, what's happening here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is amazing what's happening over here. Oh yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm glad that an offhand joke about The Gentleman led to this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is the cartoon character Daria.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those are some huge sweat drops.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, let me see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks like Daria.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Daria with a beard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jester's a really good drawer, even though I'm not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep, there's no getting around it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Imagine this is, like, DaVinci.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very Scott Pilgrim. Have you seen this woman?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you drawing, Matt, right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, yeah! If you're going to draw a picture, I'm going to draw one real fast too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Matt's a really good drawer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's not a good artist either, so she's like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's so much better!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is him!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's see, let's see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it look like the same person when we look at the two drawings?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make a connection.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So is it the same person? We need to know that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, that is quite the revelation. Your dad-- I mean, Babenon-- is tracking us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has our blood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am so confused by this, but you've talked to him, you've seen him, you know where he is?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he's in Zadash! Do you want to go see him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can't leave."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh. Oh my gosh! I'm going to send him a message, okay? And then we can see if it's him. I send a message to The Gentleman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, what do you say?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, oh my god. Is your name Babenon Dosaal? Have you ever been to the Menagerie Coast? Oh my god, do you know the Ruby of the Sea? Oh my god!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's going to think he's being wiretapped.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so the spell sends. No response.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you should say, "This is Jester."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he's gotten my messages before; he knows it's me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That message probably interrupted a threesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've seen him having sex and stuff. We haven't seen it, but we know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably doesn't bother your mom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try one more time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh gosh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do I have? Is it nighttime already?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's late evening. It's probably close to midnight by now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to think about what I'm going to say on this one. I'm using my pearl of power. It's my last 3rd-level spell. Okay. Hello Gentleman. This is Jester. Please respond. Just yes if you've seen the Ruby. Please. Is that 20? Oh, oh shit! Balls! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please tell me it plays with those exact pauses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course it does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to hear some 1988 phone voicemail message thrown on top of that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a palpable pause of nothing. And then he responds, "No, that's preposterous."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's preposterous, he says.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe it is."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did the guy that you know use words like "preposterous"?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know a lot of people use the word 'preposterous.' It's a fairly standard word."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Preposterous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: My apologies."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't even think to ask about him in Zadash, because I thought he would be in the ocean.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the ocean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he told Mama he was in the ocean!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Said he had to leave and take care of some business on the sea. I never saw him again."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just like a man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're not wrong. But though he may be gone, he left me with the greatest gift I've ever "had, so--" She runs her hands through your hair once more. "For that, I'm thankful."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you still love him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Love is a funny thing. There's still a part of my heart that will always be his. But it's been "decades. You move on."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Decades? Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That could mean literally two decades.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're 60.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you not know how old you are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course I know how old I am. I'm just questioning my mom's math, is all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Decades could be 20 years.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or 30.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm 50, 50 years old. I kick--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I stretch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Regardless." You can see she's flushed in her face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've gone through a lot tonight, so maybe we'll leave you to your peace. You need to process some things, and then in the morning we'll go not-murder this guy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Definitely not. Definitely, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I see what you did there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't. Is there a thing? Oh well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will have rooms arranged. I will send the servants to get it taken care of. You will have "the finest suites at the inn for the better part of this week, and longer if need be. Just let me "know." You can see she's a bit shaken by everything, but trying to put on the facade that she's good. "Anyway, it is a pleasure. Thank you for the companionship, for the words, for the "stories, and for bringing me my little sapphire. I should probably sleep. Good night."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you, thank you. If you need anything-- to be shown, taught-- I have friends "who can help you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't understand what that--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a freebie. You can have sex with someone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not a freebie.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine. Let's-- go ahead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I was going to ask if she could recommend any bookstores, but I was mistaken about what the topic was.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, you might not have been. I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you recommend any bookstores here in the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are a handful, I'm certain."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's call it a night. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good night." And she pours her glass full, holds it, and "Sleep well." And she kisses you on the forehead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Goodnight, Mama.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good night, Jester." Closes the door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So in this moment, does she seem okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't think she seems okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm saying for the entire evening here, even before that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that'd be more of a question for her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but I'm not asking. I'm just wondering.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do you feel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, kind of stupid for not thinking to ask The Gentleman when we met him, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ask him what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He didn't ask you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, crime boss, are you my dad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did think it was fun that we were meeting somebody else who was blue.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a lot of blue people in the world.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I assume.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're also not constantly perspiring or anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only just now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you want to have a drink and think about it, or go for a walk?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or a swim.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why would I need a swim?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, because you're half water person?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, are you going to go swimming with her?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If she wanted me to, I could.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would do that for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about a night swim?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's actually pretty dangerous to go through the Skews at night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I thought. Can I see if your fingers are webbed or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're not webbed. What if he's my dad, you guys?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, then you've had nothing but positive interactions with him, right? What did we do with him? Did we do anything weird?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've done very right by him, but we've also tipped him off to the fact that you assume that he might know your mother at a more intimate level.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that bad that I put that out there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess it depends on if he's trying to hide it or not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would be nice to see his face when you ask the question, you know what I mean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the sort of conversation one should have in person, I suppose.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a question mark right now, but there will be another chapter to that story.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll just send him messages every day.

lines.name: TALIESIN, TRAVIS
lines.text: Well--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know if that's a good idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't you give him a few days to ruminate on what you have just said, and see if anything returns? Or maybe we will return. It's your decision.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's going to be so long before we go back to Zadash, maybe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At the very least, I think you should sleep on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we turn in for the night, then?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess so. It's pretty late.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I bet you'll go right to sleep, ja?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What stories did your mom tell you about your dad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just that he was very charming, and that he wore lots of rings on his fingers, and that, you know--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He came from the sea?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that he lived on an island in the sea. And they were going to get married. He said he wanted to and he went to prepare his house and never came back. She thought maybe something bad happened to him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perhaps he's hiding, which is why he couldn't answer that question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But she said he was very charming and very sweet and very funny. He always made her laugh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's good that you got to see your mother, though. You seem very happy to see her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am. She's really wonderful, isn't she?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should go to sleep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your rooms are arranged for you. They're Pillow Trove-level presentation. The interior is warm and the beds are ostentatious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four poster, gaudy-ass--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. From what you guys are used to sleeping in, you almost don't know what to do with it once you lie in bed. It's almost too comfortable.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they all kings?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see some of the higher buildings and towers with their little perched clusters. You watch as a few dive down into the merchant districts of the city and some distant echoing yells as they shoot back up with a caught fish that was supposed to be sold. The ships are already out and starting their day. You can see maybe 20 or so that are out in the main harbor and scattering further to find their specific areas to begin throwing their nets into the water. The morning is yours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How'd you sleep, Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great! I slept really good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, I was thinking one thing that might help take your mind off this is making sure your mom stays safe. Right? Take some solid steps to making sure that-- Galdar?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Algar.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Algar Dyomin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That he stops.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go find him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have an idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, what's your idea?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you go on a date with him, fall in love with him, get pregnant, then he'll want to settle down and make you an honest woman and he'll never go back to your mom again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's perfect, but then I might have to stay with him. I don't want to do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There is actually a lot to do this morning. I feel like we should send some to check out the lighthouse, maybe talk to the Wharfmaster, and maybe send someone to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe go to this Open Quay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, just some lax scouting, you know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll head to the lighthouse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're trying to find him? Where he lives? Who he works for?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything, I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Survey the territory.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You should probably be speaking to the people on the docks, yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I would like to find the Wharfmaster.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder where the Concord-- yeah, where they're based. Isn't there a headquarters?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually the palace-like center here--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Marquis?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Marquis is the head of the local chapter of the Concord that looks over Nicodranas. The Concord itself is a loose union between all the cities in the Menagerie Coast. There's a margrave in each city that is the head of the city but then works with the other margraves to interface and make sure everything's good, bad, and business is well. That would be the center of Concord influence here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Meet back here in a little while and share?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to do two groups?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I suppose we could. Lighthouse and the Wharfmaster?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Works for me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we can all meet up at the Quay afterwards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Open Quay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a great idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Midday?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Midday at the Quay?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Midday at the quay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you say?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Wharfmaster is going to tell us what now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, why are we talking to the Wharfmaster?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to talk to the Wharfmaster.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus it would be a good chance to ask around about Algar. He's influential in the city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In Zemnian, it's pronounced "key." You said "quay"?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is a quay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so confused. Let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's going to the lighthouse?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: People who can talk. They said that she's ornery.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. You three. Nott, do you want to come to the Wharfmaster so you can take a swim?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go to the lighthouse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also on the water.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go with you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Guns out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about you, Jessie?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to the lighthouse, I said.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four to the lighthouse, two to the Wharfmaster. I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Heading to the Wharfmaster is Fjord and Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Biceps and triceps.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, so this is my turf.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There may be some familiar faces. We came in before and I didn't change the way I looked. I wanted to see if maybe that caused a rustle. I'm going to change the way I look now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. You didn't notice anything before when you came in as is?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do people not like you here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's what drove me out, so I think I'll be able to discover more if--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you're not--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- me. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Deal. Am I your servant, your bodyguard? Am I your yes-man? I can be your yes-man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hype man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Copy that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Had some better days in the '80s.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Steven. So you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Russian accent. Vague.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My name is Sheagal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (Sean Connery voice) Steven Seagal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Sean Connery voice) I suddennly remembered my Charlemagne. (normal voice) Doesn't work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't work. The two of you make your way back to the Restless Wharf. You're searching for the Wharfmaster, specifically? Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And since Beau's helping you you can do advantage on that one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. That was the same roll both times. That was really shit. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Beau, have you retrieved the Professor, or have you left it with the inn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's staying at the inn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You spend the better part of two hours or so wandering up and down the wharf, asking questions, before you eventually have somebody point you over. "If you looking for the "Wharfmaster, he's at the Wharflode right there," and points over one of the larger center parts of the dock that jettisons out into the harbor a good hundred or so feet. There is a central dock house that is one of the buildings you saw when you first entered, where you saw a lot of the business was bustling around, although it is not as busy as it was at dusk when you first entered the city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of course the Wharfmaster is at the Wharflode. We probably should have checked there first. Why didn't we do that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a handful of Zhelezo looking around, but it looks like entering the Wharflode isn't a notably guarded experience. So as you enter, there is one Zhelezo across the way that is sitting in a chair and looking out and chewing on some sort of rough tobacco-like leaf in their jaw. Across the way, you can see a couple of folks-- humans-- in the process of filing out big leather books, ledgers, and receipt books of various people traveling through. And you see in the back over a table with a bunch of papers rolled out, either charting maps or large assembled lists of previous excursions. You see a male dwarf, probably middle to older age, red hair that tends to eventually expire into a deep gray at the end of this really curly matted beard. You see big, gold, thick earrings that hoop from each earlobe-- the weight of this heavy, thick lobe has dragged the ears to stretch a bit past the face. The hairline comes in a deep widow's peak, that recedes almost back to the top of the head before coming in, and there you can see, in a similar tangled tuft, the rest of his hair that coasts past his shoulders before it exerts into a strange puff. He is wearing a simple leather tunic over a work uniform, but three or four fairly expensive necklaces or amulets that clatter around as he moves. You get the sense of his placement by the other individuals going up and asking him questions, he's probably the Wharfmaster.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll make my way up to him, if he's not busy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks busy, and there is a counter that prevents you from traveling in without going around it. As you begin to make your way around the counter, one of the individuals up there puts his hand out. "Whoa, whoa, whoa! Can I help you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (raspy, older voice) Yes, I'm so sorry, I was wondering if I might be able to speak with the Wharfmaster. And I'll produce two gold coins and start to rub them together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll see what I can do." He takes the coins and pockets them, and walks behind and begins whispering. The dwarf puts his hand up for a second and finishes making a couple measurements and then, "Huh. All right." He jumps off his small stool and comes over with heavy footsteps across the wooden, creaking floor now extending over the wharf. He approaches the edge of the counter across from you and goes, "Right, so you've summoned me to you. What can I do to help you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry, we're quite new in town, unfortunately, my companion and I. We are from Port Damali, where we are trying to put down our business roots here. I'm sorry, does Vandren and his crew, do they make shipments here regularly? It's one of my return clients.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 26, off of a natural 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you have advantage on that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Why did I roll advantage on that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was your first roll?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 20. Why did I do that? Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know, just double checking. He looks at you and goes, "Hold on a second." You see his gears turning and he goes through a couple books. "Unfortunately, by the records "records we have here, Vandren and his ship was lost at sea months ago."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I apologize."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's quite unfortunate. I've been given a task here in town. Algar, does he do a lot of business here on the wharf?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, he comes and goes rather commonly, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I happen to have crossed paths with him one night while drinking. I guess we made quite the impression on him, and we are to deliver some items to his place of residence. However, my friend here was shit-faced and we forgot to ask where he lives. I was hoping, perhaps, if you could give us a point in the right direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I honestly don't know where he lives. But I know where he works."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yes, then, that would be most helpful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, he works in the Sluice Weave."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Sluice Weave. Not loose leaf, Sluice Weave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Sluice Weave." S-L-U-I-C-E. Sluice Weave.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I definitely wrote down "Sloose Sweef."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sloose Sweef! There you go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh fantastic, that helps us immensely. Do you know of anyone else looking for a merchant, perhaps on the cheaper side, services?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We sell things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, rare things and very boring things, at times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you are looking to sell, you are welcome to go to either Meandering Treasures, here in the "Restless Wharf. They tend to pay, maybe not top change, but quickly. As far as Deezema does his business, usually."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Deezema?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Deezema. He is the proprietor of the Meandering Treasures."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I thank you for your time. Are there any available docks for rent or for lease if we happen to come upon some vessels or ships?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have--" and he looks back to one of his sheets of paper and pulls it out for a second and looks at it. "We currently have eight dock spaces not spoken for that are available for rent, if "that is your interest. Depending on the size of the vessel, of course."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seems like a lot of dock spaces. Have a lot of openings? Business been slow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, we've just had a lot of ships leave recently. There is a lot of movement in and out."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh sure. Just curious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One other thing, we heard a gentleman over at the bar speaking, and someone called out to him, "Marius LePual." Does that ring-- how do you say that name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How were we saying the last name?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Les Paul.

lines.name: MATT
