lines.text: He's like, "I've seen him around. He's a dubious sort of prick."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, very gregarious personality from what we could see. What does he do exactly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fuck if I know, to be honest. He takes up space. He's done some work at the docks here and "there, but he rubs me the wrong way. Probably find him drinking at any of the dives."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is where we should look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If not drowned already."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah, yes. We did notice actually last night, there seemed to be an influx of strange characters coming in last night. Did you happen to see anything around this area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There were some strange cats that came in last night off the docks, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything in particular that caught your eye?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He starts giving you a curious look. "You're asking a lot of questions for a person I've just met."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry, I'm so new here. I was just hoping to acclimate myself and perhaps--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Let me give you a very prestigious piece of advice, I think that will "help you in your business dealings here: Don't ask so many questions."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah. Yes. Perhaps it's time we take our leave.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (grunts)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, salt water air is not (coughs) used to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And kind of like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we do like the three backward steps and then the turn and then both walk out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That went well, right? That was really great, right? I was fucking awesome!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you were great!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you! I was just following your lead, man. You know, just nodding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that came out of nowhere. You got a lot better at that. Okay. So, I don't know, where do we start? Well, I guess we meet back up with the others.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And he said that guy hangs out at the dives.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So like, two birds, one stone?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Smash. All right, let's get him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you guys doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to head to-- what time is it, ish?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it is mid-day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point in time, I'd say it's probably a little past noon since the morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, fuck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's mid-day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we should go meet with the others.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. We go to the Open Quay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: During the day here, and as you approach, there are a few fishermen that come up. There are a number of small, wooden plates that are weathered and dried and cracked in places; they've been left out for a long time. They'll walk up and place dried meat, fish they've caught, sometimes somewhat ripened and some rotting fruit that have been placed there. These appear to be offerings as a subtle worship to the Wildmother. You are familiar with some of these practices, though not quite as crass, usually, in presentation, but it seems to work for travelers that wish for safe exit from port.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really pretty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should go inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to go inside and talk to Gladys, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if it looks like-- you can still tell that there's boobs from the inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe it's built into the architecture of the rooms within.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (snickering) Maybe you can sleep in one of the boobs. Let's go!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only one way to find out, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll find the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You walk over to the door. It is a standard, thick, dark wooden door with a small slot to look through that is currently closed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (knocking)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wait about a minute and there's no response.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (knocking louder)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The louder one seems to echo a bit, and after another minute or so of waiting, you hear this faint creaking sound.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's haunted!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a robot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets louder and louder until eventually, the small door opens and you see this really shriveled woman's face. These beady, little, dark eyes peeking through and goes, "Can I help you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you Gladys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're supposed to talk. My name's Caduceus. Mother sent me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check. With advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Calm motherfucker.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mother sent me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not terrible. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her arms, while the skin itself is sagging and wrinkled, there are some guns on this old woman. Her hair is a tuft of tightly curled white hair. No glasses, just the beady, little, dark eyes. Where she smiles, the wrinkles cause this butterfly effect across the rest of her face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And human?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Human, yes. "So you invoked the Mother. I assume you are also a follower of hers?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am, I am. This is a long and complicated story, I suppose. We've been holding the north against something dark. Something threatens our small temple. Have you ever been to the Blooming Grove before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I cannot say that I have, my apologies."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's quite all right. This has been the first sign of the Mother I've seen since leaving my home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I'm happy that she could be a beacon to you as she's been to so many who have "passed through Nicodranas."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's a really big beacon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Her temple is under threat up north. I was waiting for a sign and I think this is the sign.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps her guidance is going to be very useful to you in seeking out a way to cleanse this temple you speak of."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. I'm so sorry, how rude, my friends and I-- it's only fitting. Is there any service that we can provide for you, for your graciousness in allowing us into your lighthouse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I cannot guarantee entry to the top at least--" and peeks around behind to the rest of you.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hello."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hallo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you sleep in the boob?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The triple blink afterwards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know if I can be of much help to you. I am but a simple mistress of the tower, but--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel that there is wisdom here. Would it be possible to learn more about this place, possibly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can tell you of its history. Come in."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All of us? Noisy out here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sure."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So many horses on this lighthouse!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Kept trying to find the right audio file, and now this kept coming up real busy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We shoot horses outside, just on Tuesdays!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a really busy wharf, guys. Anyway. Fuck me for trying to add atmosphere, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's juggling a lot of plates.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We know!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Please. Last week I was like, "How does this shit work? What do I do here?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good. As she lets you all in with a bit of a grimace, she goes, "All right. This is the lighthouse."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is of the Mother. Melora looks over those ships at sea. Keeps them safe."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not just the ships at sea, but farmers as well, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably. But the lighthouse mainly helps the sea."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So this is kind of like a temple then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "More or less."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How long have you been presiding over it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have been here for the entirety of my life, for now 86 years in Nicodranas."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is respectable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You climb all these stairs all the time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. That's how I've gotten to this age and still as spry as ever." Starts walking up the first set of stairs. "Come! You should see the view."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very excited.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god, I love her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As we walk: I know this was our way in or whatever, but we've got to cut to the chase at some point, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What chase?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's been a lot of fore-pony, but we need to get to the actual-- (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fucking callback. Amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are we supposed to ask about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: About the guy, about Al Gore Dyomin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll get there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We should call him Al Gore!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Al Gore! He invented the Internet!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's an inconvenient moment right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck your character names.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're having a moment right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh man. You just triple lutzed over Purvan and flew beyond.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we need to ask about the guy that we came to ask about. So wrap up the god stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "'Tis not for sleeping, and it is not the Mother's boob."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's her eyeballs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance up, and you can see now there is a window that's set right about where the clavicle is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just kidding, it's where her clavicle is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it's past the boob.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a beautiful view of the entire harbor, especially this time of day when the sun's at its peak. You see this beautiful set of ships out there and fishing vessels and galleons and a handful of different designs to each, different make from all over the world. There's one that appears to be of Marquesian make. You can even see through the very clear ocean waters here, you can see shapes far below the waves from this view as well. You can see elements of a reef in the distance. You can see a few broken and long silt-covered remnants of ships that had sunk in this harbor from long ago. It's breathtaking in a way you weren't expecting. "You can keep gawking, "if that is your preference, but the lighthouse is up top. Follow me."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Exciting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the top floor, you have the view of everything around you, not just that front view of the harbor, but this beautiful image of the ocean and the shoreline and the fields and rolling hills that surround Nicodranas, of the Cyrios Mountains to the north, and then far to the east you can see the jungles that then vanish up the sides of the Ashkeeper Peaks. It's a tremendous view, and then the entire city below. It's, once again, increasingly breathtaking from the one you previously had. "This is my home."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a really good home.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a lot of steps. I can see why you're in such good shape, Grandmother.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Damn right. You should keep up, do more cardio."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You get a lot of visitors here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, not really."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really? But it's so cool inside, why don't people want to come see you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Kind of prickly."

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, seriously. If your friend with the pink hair wasn't here, I wasn't going to let you in."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a good one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not even looking at the view, I'm looking at the lighthouse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see now the marine layer starting to burn away in the midday and most of the fog is receded towards the horizon, the blue sky having returned-- you see this rough-cut, quartz-like crystal that's about three and a half, four feet in diameter, that's set in the center of this top floor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to compare it to mine a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is my responsibility to invoke the Mother's blessing of the stone and each day, have "its light guide the ships back to safe shore."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have my own responsibilities to her as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can sense. Even looking upon you, I can smell decay."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This place, it's so different. Was it perhaps a gift from the Lawbearer, long ago?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They two, the union, blessed upon this shore the gifts of stone that then built this tower."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have two favors that I would ask of you, and I understand if they're not possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I can maybe help with one and probably laugh at the other. So choose carefully."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very fair. We have a friend in town in need of a good turn, and this good turn-- we have a friend who's threatened and we're hoping to maybe glean some information.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's my mom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's my friend's mother.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A mother, so there's your in right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Cute."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's having difficulty with somebody.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Al Gore Dyomin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Algar.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Algar Dyomin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've seen this man around in the streets below."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've just seen him from above? Have you ever talked to him or any of his--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I don't really talk to people, I look at them below." She points over to the edge and there's actually a spyglass leaning against the edge She goes, "I see a lot "that goes on in this city."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you perhaps see the thing beneath the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. But I know there are things beneath it."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I fear that he may be in contact with something inappropriate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you see where he goes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are a couple of places, I believe."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know where he lives?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do not know where he lives."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look through your spyglass please?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, tell us where--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check with disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Easily distracted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's shiny.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's shiny.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw! Why, though? 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you instinctually reach for the spyglass, she slaps your hand. "No."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Insolent child."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keep on target.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But it seemed like you were about to discuss-- you've seen his pattern in the city, where he goes day to day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are two submerged gates in the harbor."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Sluice Weave, perhaps you are talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Sluice Weave, yes." Not that you'd know that, technically.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said Sluice Weave. Oh, they said it? Eh, shit happens. Forget it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine, it's all good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Banished from the game!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. You're done! Caleb is murdered. No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Meta that Sluice, there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (pigeon cooing) Sluice Weave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I killed like seven of them already.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, boy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two submerged gates under the harbor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs) "The harbor has protectors, and has for many generations, that exist beneath the "waters in this city. That is part of how the Sluice functions. I believe this Algar person you "mentioned works in some sort of managerial position there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At the Sluice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At the Sluice. So we go there and we can go down-- do we have to swim to get in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably need some sort of a small boat or something. But if you're going to go there and you "don't have approval, you'll probably be arrested."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I don't want to be arrested.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sure we can figure something out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you a goblin?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I look like a goblin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And you're working with these people?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They looked past my hideous features to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not hideous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She's pretty hideous."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She is invaluable to us. She is a capable woman. We need her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She does good work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I may be ugly on the outside, but inside I am--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're wonderful and you're beautiful on the outside, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're hardly ugly on the outside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look, it's okay. It is something we have in common."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What, do you think I've lived alone here my whole live because I'm a spinster?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I mean-- you seem like a relatively normal-looking person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (scoffs) "It's okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think you're beautiful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think you could snap me like a twig.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think I could too."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do have my last request, and I'll take these people out of your hair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please. They're beginning to grate on me."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm looking for a sign of where to go next. I'm waiting for the Mother to speak. Is there a place to sit quietly and find her voice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's the laughing thing she said.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah, that's fair. For your trouble. I'm going to pull out one of my teas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sniffs) "What is this?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's blessed from the Mother herself, from one of the graves of the less scrupulous families of the north. Good for muscle tension, I find. Grew it myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is a very kind gesture, very thoughtful."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You serve the Mother well. It's only fair that you be rewarded.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You as well. All right, now get out!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for your time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sets it down on a little side table, and quickly pushes you back towards the stairs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does she start walking us down the stairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, above you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was a long walk, though. This is an awkward goodbye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're not ganking that telescope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not trying to gank the telescope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's trying to get in the boob.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you trying to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I wanted to-- before she started ushering us out-- to Invoke Duplicity. And make it look like I was in front her but really stay behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to end poorly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was also going to say, as they went down, that Caleb is going to make a big to-do and start saying: You know, we didn't have a chance to talk about when we're above. I am in the market for some books, and I was wondering if you knew of any bookstores.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I'm going to give myself the Blessing of the Trickster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got to do that beforehand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Motherfuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did it go?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you call dibs on the dodeca?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Eight. Not stealthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She begins to walk past you, then stops and turns right and looks right at you and goes, "Are you going to join your friend of you?" (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm. Yeah, I'm coming downstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. Go!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, Jessie!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've mastered standing so still.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you know, a full-on library, or perhaps, you know, a smutty bookshop even, because you never know what you're going to find in there. Or even a used, a vintage book-- Oh, you're not even-- (shouting) Are there any bookstores in the vicinity of this lighthouse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, out. Thank you for the tea, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (door slamming) (locks clicking)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you heard of our lord and savior, The Traveler?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought she was really nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's pretty cool. I liked her a lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think she liked most of us, but she's pretty cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She loved us. We were great. Me and my duplicate skip away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's go. Its midday; we got to go to the Open Quay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you mean for that to rhyme, or was that just--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's been rhyming a lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's the first time I got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beauregard, what's your passive perception?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My passive perception? 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, they're down here, actually. Okay, good to know. All right, you guys eventually meet up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long have we been outside now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have been outside probably about three hours or so, total. Of travel and asking and getting questions, I'd say two and a half.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you keeping your-- just spelling and spelling and spelling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm doing my Disguise spell and keeping it up the whole time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should get you a disguise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That probably would be smarter than what I'm doing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an emerald stone-- dark green with elements of light green flecked through it-- spire that seems very out of place amongst the rest of the storage buildings, and the various other small homesteads and businesses that fill this entire area. It seems to be dotted with a number of small balconies, and comes to a slight roofed peak that is like a sharpened point. It's very out of place here. You've passed by it a couple times before, but you haven't really inquired much about it, as most of your business here had been on the job, so you've not really cared to ask or question.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was going to say, as we're walking, can we snag a passerby and ask what that structure is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can I help you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very unique. What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's Tide Peak. That's the tower of Yussa Errennis, the mage who owns this district."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a mage that owns this district?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. To the chagrin of the Clovis Concord, yes."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The chagrin?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They don't get on, do they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You could say that. I need to get to work."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yussa Renis?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yussa, Y-U-S-S-A.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yussa Errenis?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Errenis, E-R-R-E-N-I-S.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We got a wizard's tower.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wizard's tower! Flank up it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's where you find carpets, I was about to say, yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lead us to the carpet!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Around the Tide Peak, do we see the Zhelezo, the guards around it? Or is it not as guarded as other structures are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are Zhelezo around the area. They're still keeping the peace here, but there are no Zhelezo guarding the tower.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we far away? Hundreds of feet? Less?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, a few hundred feet, I would say, from the tower.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it stands out like a sore thumb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure a detour wouldn't hurt us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, it's on the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A closeup. Scenic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, it's fine, exactly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do it. We'll make a detour to go closer to that on the way to the Open Quay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You approach it. The district distinctly around this tower, the road is very wide surrounding it. No buildings are buttressed against it. It seems to be solitary amongst the rest of the constructed buildings here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like people deliberately trying to stay away from it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The folks that are walking in the streets nearby tend to walk on the opposite side of the road.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No bodies of water, pools, lakes, decorative?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. It's just ground. It's built in the center of this district, and everything's either built or shaped around it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like it's been there for a really long damn time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 15. Wait, nope, 19. Wrong thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell how long it's been here. It seems like it could've been installed last week, or 25, 30 years ago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How close did Beau get to investigate like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About ten feet before you began to really make that assessment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought he said, "before you started to melt."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sizzling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Weird that they're avoiding the thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, these bricks look so new.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And green. Why so different? Can we touch the outside of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go and touch it. It's cold stone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you see an entrance?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did I see an entrance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it a super long-- like a tower?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's a tower spire, but the base of it is probably somewhere between 80 to 100 feet in diameter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about we nonchalantly walk by the entrance to get an idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Do you want to go that way and I'll go that way? Meet around? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys run around, meet on the other side. No entrance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The fuck?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't see a door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, me neither.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Windows?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No windows. There are the balconies, but the first balcony is maybe 25 feet up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there flying carpet ports?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, I keep thinking of Allura's tower.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 25-feet-up balcony, and other balconies above that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At its peak, it's probably about 450 feet tall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit, it's real tall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's this long spire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, dang.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, how do you get into a tower with no doors?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd imagine you fly. Or maybe there's an underground entrance? Around, go under, and up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. You can't parkour up that wall 25 feet, can you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you asking me to try?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, you want to give me a boost?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I absolutely would love it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I want to see if I can boost off of Fjord and maybe get up to this tower. Does it look like these are bricks that can--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 25 feet is pretty far.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very high. Wait, 25 feet, 45 feet? 25 feet's a lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the world's largest mimic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, and to help the visual thing, I said 100 feet wide diameter. That's a bit wide for what I was originally thinking. It's about maybe 60 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In diameter. But can I climb up to the balcony?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm helping her, I'm giving her the old (grunting).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Acrobatics, acrobatics.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Broad daylight, scaling a building.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, one hundred percent, a terrible idea. A building that everyone is trying to avoid in town. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage because he's helping you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not that one. Cobalt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take the 17. I know, it was almost a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You run, leap. Fjord catches your foot and gives you the meager, not very strong lift, but something to help. Your first foot hits the wall, the second one hits, and you get a moment of traction. Before you (slipping). You only get maybe 12, 13 feet off the ground before you (impact).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did not catch her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you dived out of the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord steps back and you (whack).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Catch me! Ca-- what?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Goosh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My ass bone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry, I'm not real strong. I thought you'd make it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought I would too! It's really slippy stone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're getting damage because of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, 1d6 per ten feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thankfully, you have slow fall as a monk ability.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do. Which I've never had to use.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would take six points of bludgeoning damage from the fall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I reduce my damage five times my monk level, up to 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's all of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, monks can fall from very high and three-point landing and be fine. You still hit your tailbone and it still stings a little, but you don't take any damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll let the others know? Okay, and we'll go to the Open Quay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aren't you supposed to fall gracefully as a monk, then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you reach up as hard as you could right before you landed to split that speed? Is that how monks work?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, definitely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys round the corner, and you watch Beau suddenly slam into the ground near the central tower.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep, there's our friends.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ay, that's Beau.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's going on? Why are you jumping up and down?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I was just doing some one-finger push-ups.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no doors.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why were you trying to get into this tower?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I've seen it several times coming through before. It's called the Tide Peak, but there are no doors.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well okay, I've seen all kinds of places many times that I didn't try to get into immediately. What were you trying to accomplish?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did they have doors?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. So you saw it as a challenge, you saw it as a mountain to climb?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, everybody seems to be avoiding it, it sticks out in the general area, and there's no doors. I just found it odd. Maybe it's a puzzle?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also apparently he's a wizard that has a beef.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we can blink into it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, maybe! They said there's a mage here that presides over this district.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's interesting. How does it pertain to what we are trying to do today?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: It doesn't.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you for keeping us on task, Caleb.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, do you know anything about this tower?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but we do know about the Sluice. We heard about a place called the Sluice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We heard the same!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's where this fellow, Algar, might be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Sluice Weave?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it was just called the Sluice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretty sure it's the Sluice Weave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's underwater or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you find it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we just heard about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go find it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to get a boat, but we can't just go there because we'll be arrested.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't know, the old lady said that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, you need an invite?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a gate that protects the city from bad underwater creatures or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we heard the whole thing was underwater. Did you hear that? Like submerged?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Something like that, submerged gates or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we don't have to go, we could keep working on this tower.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I feel like you're throwing a lot of shade about us investigating this tower.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We were here on time, you know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we were killing time. It is midday, we are at the Quay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He gets a little picky when he hasn't had a book in a while. So we just need to find him a book and he'll be okay for a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, you would think the wizard would be fascinated with the idea of the wizard tower that's very mysterious in the middle of the city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is very interesting, but I thought we were helping our friend here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have wizard envy? It's okay, it's a very large tower.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right, that's an easy thing to go to, so go to it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Long and rather skinny, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did you find?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We did find out that Marius LePual-- fuck that last name. He's sometimes seen at some of the taverns around, some of the shadier ones. The Skew or the Open Quay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, well we're in a shady area, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we're close to Marius LePual. We're also close to the Sluice, maybe? Is that close to here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that close to here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't really know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Goddamn it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, let's go into the Quay, we haven't been in yet, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the Quay is the district. You're in the district right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're in the district, it's like a wharf.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, but the Open Quay was a low-life dive, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a low-life area.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought The Skew was the low-life area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, The Skew is a place where you can live.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's a heavily residential district for the more affordable and cheaper residents.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is the Quay inside The Skew?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Meandering Treasurer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Meandering Treasurer is a shop.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is a shop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a bar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go find a bar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: SAM. Yeah. I will aid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, please do. Okay okay okay, that's 17 again. Nope, sorry, 15. Keep looking at the wrong numbers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're looking around the Open Quay, there are a few people that point you towards The Withered Bird Inn, which is an inn and tavern, and you've probably passed by it before once the direction is pointed out, you're like, "Yeah, no I've been there, it's a little dive-y but it's popular "amongst the sailors and folks that come through." If you're looking for something in the Restless Wharf, the only place that really comes to your attention that's told is The Wayfarer's Cove.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've been told about that place!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's where they said Marius LePual might hang out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Wayfarer's Cove is-- is supposed to be delivered to Marius--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's why!

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: We should go there!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go there!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're stupid, we could have gone there already.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we're not looking for Marius LePual, we're looking for Al Gore!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Algar.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Algar. But we should still go there because we can maybe kill two birds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you've already got seven dead birds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got seven dead birds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: More birds must die!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We get nine birds! It's nine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got to take what's given to us and right now we don't have an invite to get down to the Sluice. So we might as well go by The Wayfarer's Cove.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we're in the Quay, how far away in The Wayfarer's Cove?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's maybe 30 minutes away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 30 fucking minutes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's 400 feet tall, no doors.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll come back to the tower. We'll go to the Wayfarer's Cove.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you climb 25 feet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We were at a lighthouse that is even taller than this, you we could go try to climb that, if you'd like?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, you blot out the sun everywhere you go, Caleb.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, salt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way out of the Open Quay towards the Restless Wharf district once more. Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You keep looking over your shoulder, your interest towards the Tide Peak tower. It's interesting: the further away from it you get, the shorter it looks, and you begin to understand how you didn't notice a 400-foot tower when you first entered the city or one you've been around before, and you've been to this city before. It seems the further away you walk, the tower seems to visually shrink within the city skyline. It's still visible as a tower, and it's still taller than most of the buildings, but as soon as you guys get quite a ways away, you're like, "That can't be more than "maybe 150 feet tall."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are continuing on, but I just want to point out that the place with no doors also fucking shrunk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fjord, 100% it is very interesting and I have checked the box in the back of my brain. I do want to understand what that place is--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it tickles your pickle, doesn't it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hmm. I'm curious, but let's shelve it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Has Yussa ever come to see my mom sing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Within, something's up, mm-hmm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, this is coming from the guy who spent two hours in a smut shop trying to find magic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that you're embarrassed for wasting your time here, but you will get over it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's find the bar, please!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys! Look at this cute puppy. Look at this adorable puppy. It's such a cutie pie!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Make it do the thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Make it blink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Poof!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It vanishes, and then you hear (poof) and you look over your shoulder. One of the small tables on the side of one of the various warehouses that contained a bucket that had a bunch of tools and various repair materials for ships has been knocked over, and the puppy's tumbling out of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Poof!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to go save our puppy, come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Runs up to you and jumps back into your arms.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was so close, that was really close to us that time!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aww, it's so cute. Right, guys?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I really want. You know how little puppies, they crash into things when they're they're walking? Every time he poofs out, I just want--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's basically what he is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's a fainting blink dog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's cute though, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Puppies are useless at this age, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just saying he's cute, so let's be friends again and let's just keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Finishing the rest of your jaunt here as Fjord is making equations in the air in front of him, you eventually make your way, by asking a few more questions, towards the Wayfarer's Cove. As you approach this dark looking dive, that is probably furthest of all the other bars or taverns you've seen here out towards the docks itself. The super dark wood that it's constructed of makes it look almost like a blighted barnacle on the rest of this wharf area. As you approach the exterior, you can see a large piece of driftwood that probably belonged to a ship long before that had either fallen in the ocean or, after its final voyage, was pulled apart and then elements of it were used to either build or embellish on the structure. It looks like the kind of bar that was salvaged, or was built from salvage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Rad. I know, so cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you step through the entry way, the door's open, slightly ajar, you pull it open. The interior has no music, there is just whispers and conversation. The smell hits you immediately, the smell is a combination of mossy musk from wood that has been soaked with seawater and then left to dry hundreds of times over, as well as the various forms of liquor and ale that have been spilled and left to stain the wood where it lies, and a lot unwashed sailor scent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we're going to pick up next week.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! So awesome!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was so awesome!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like turtles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The tower!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody was so cool in there!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like turtles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a weird place!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your home city is cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you invent it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I made up everything in that city, guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So there's a crotchety half-elf bartender, the tortle with tattoos, the redheaded human woman and then she was with a man?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, like a sea-- like a normal crew mate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She had dark, kind of caught crazy hair that--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You said it was grayish, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It goes gray about halfway down and goes to a gray-white at the tips. It's this mane of hair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A salt and pepper situation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Salt and pepper, Steven Seagal!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should ask if we have many gifts to offer and see if a trap door opens or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, I like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll pick up in the next week. In the meantime, we missed you guys! Happy to be back in the game. Even one week off, it was jonesing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What a wild ride, tonight was.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that was a lot of stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dads and blood and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So exotic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a later game reveal that the right questions brought forward as a possibility.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All the strudel and schnitzel are so far away now and we are in this exotic place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's time for oysters.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yes, thank you again to our fantastic sponsors, the wonderful folks at The Rook and the Raven and their awesome Kickstarter, go check it out! And D&D Beyond which, now and have been for a while, available you can get their Dragon Heist downloaded on your D&D Beyond info.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't forget to get tickets for our live show in New York City on the Ticketmaster or on critrole.com.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you are near NYC, make your way over!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We want to see you there on October 4th.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a very classic radio reporter type voice!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [music]
